ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK

block.text: MARK

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 1
The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

block.text: Inilah permulaan Injil tentang Yesus Kristus, Anak Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As it is written in the prophets,

block.text: Seperti ada tertulis dalam kitab nabi Yesaya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.

block.text: <<Lihatlah, Aku menyuruh utusan-Ku mendahului Engkau, ia akan mempersiapkan jalan bagi-Mu;

ReferenceBlocks.text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight!’”

block.text: ada suara orang yang berseru-seru di padang gurun: <Persiapkanlah jalan untuk Tuhan, luruskanlah jalan bagi-Nya> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: John came preaching in the wilderness, saying:

block.text: demikianlah Yohanes Pembaptis tampil di padang gurun dan menyerukan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Repent and be baptized for the forgiveness of sins.”

block.text: <<Bertobatlah dan berilah dirimu dibaptis dan Allah akan mengampuni dosamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the country of Judea and all those of Jerusalem went out to him. They were baptized by him in the Jordan river, confessing their sins.

block.text: Lalu datanglah kepadanya orang-orang dari seluruh daerah Yudea dan semua penduduk Yerusalem, dan sambil mengaku dosanya mereka dibaptis di sungai Yordan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John was clothed with camel’s hair and a leather belt around his waist. He ate locusts and wild honey.
He preached, saying,

block.text: Yohanes memakai jubah bulu unta dan ikat pinggang kulit, dan makanannya belalang dan madu hutan.
Inilah yang diberitakannya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “After me comes he who is mightier than I, the thong of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and loosen.

block.text: <<Sesudah aku akan datang Ia yang lebih berkuasa dari padaku; membungkuk dan membuka tali kasut-Nyapun aku tidak layak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I baptized you in water, but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.”

block.text: Aku membaptis kamu dengan air, tetapi Ia akan membaptis kamu dengan Roh Kudus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.

block.text: Pada waktu itu datanglah Yesus dari Nazaret di tanah Galilea, dan Ia dibaptis di sungai Yordan oleh Yohanes.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately coming up from the water, he saw the heavens parting, and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.

block.text: Pada saat Ia keluar dari air, Ia melihat langit terkoyak, dan Roh seperti burung merpati turun ke atas-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A voice came out of the sky,

block.text: Lalu terdengarlah suara dari sorga:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”

block.text: <<Engkaulah Anak-Ku yang Kukasihi, kepada-Mulah Aku berkenan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness.

block.text: Segera sesudah itu Roh memimpin Dia ke padang gurun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was there in the wilderness forty days tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals; and the angels were serving him.

block.text: Di padang gurun itu Ia tinggal empat puluh hari lamanya, dicobai oleh Iblis. Ia berada di sana di antara binatang-binatang liar dan malaikat-malaikat melayani Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now after John was taken into custody, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom of God,
and saying,

block.text: Sesudah Yohanes ditangkap datanglah Yesus ke Galilea memberitakan Injil Allah,
kata-Nya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The time is fulfilled, and the Kingdom of God is at hand! Repent, and believe in the Good News.”

block.text: <<Waktunya telah genap; Kerajaan Allah sudah dekat. Bertobatlah dan percayalah kepada Injil!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Ketika Yesus sedang berjalan menyusur danau Galilea, Ia melihat Simon dan Andreas, saudara Simon. Mereka sedang menebarkan jala di danau, sebab mereka penjala ikan.
Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come after me, and I will make you into fishers for men.”

block.text: <<Mari, ikutlah Aku dan kamu akan Kujadikan penjala manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately they left their nets, and followed him.

block.text: Lalu merekapun segera meninggalkan jalanya dan mengikuti Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Going on a little further from there, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother, who were also in the boat mending the nets.

block.text: Dan setelah Yesus meneruskan perjalanan-Nya sedikit lagi, dilihat-Nya Yakobus, anak Zebedeus, dan Yohanes, saudaranya, sedang membereskan jala di dalam perahu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he called them, and they left their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him.

block.text: Yesus segera memanggil mereka dan mereka meninggalkan ayahnya, Zebedeus, di dalam perahu bersama orang-orang upahannya lalu mengikuti Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught.

block.text: Mereka tiba di Kapernaum. Setelah hari Sabat mulai, Yesus segera masuk ke dalam rumah ibadat dan mengajar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes.

block.text: Mereka takjub mendengar pengajaran-Nya, sebab Ia mengajar mereka sebagai orang yang berkuasa, tidak seperti ahli-ahli Taurat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,
saying,

block.text: Pada waktu itu di dalam rumah ibadat itu ada seorang yang kerasukan roh jahat. Orang itu berteriak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ha! What do we have to do with you, Jesus, you Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!”

block.text: <<Apa urusan-Mu dengan kami, hai Yesus orang Nazaret? Engkau datang hendak membinasakan kami? Aku tahu siapa Engkau: Yang Kudus dari Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus rebuked him, saying,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus menghardiknya, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be quiet, and come out of him!”

block.text: <<Diam, keluarlah dari padanya!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with
a loud voice, came out of him.

block.text: Roh jahat itu menggoncang-goncang orang itu, dan sambil menjerit
dengan suara nyaring ia keluar dari padanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying,

block.text: Mereka semua takjub, sehingga mereka memperbincangkannya, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is this? A new teaching? For with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!”

block.text: <<Apa ini? Suatu ajaran baru. Ia berkata-kata dengan kuasa.>> <<Roh-roh jahatpun diperintah-Nya dan mereka taat kepada-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The report of him went out immediately everywhere into all the region of Galilee and its surrounding area.

block.text: Lalu tersebarlah dengan cepat kabar tentang Dia ke segala penjuru di seluruh Galilea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately, when they had come out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

block.text: Sekeluarnya dari rumah ibadat itu Yesus dengan Yakobus dan Yohanes pergi ke rumah Simon dan Andreas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick with a fever, and immediately they told him about her.

block.text: Ibu mertua Simon terbaring karena sakit demam. Mereka segera memberitahukan keadaannya kepada Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came and took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever immediately left her, and she served them.

block.text: Ia pergi ke tempat perempuan itu, dan sambil memegang tangannya Ia membangunkan dia, lalu lenyaplah demamnya. Kemudian perempuan itu melayani mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At evening, when the sun had set, they brought to him all who were sick, and those who were possessed by demons.

block.text: Menjelang malam, sesudah matahari terbenam, dibawalah kepada Yesus semua orang yang menderita sakit dan yang kerasukan setan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the city was gathered together at the door.

block.text: Maka berkerumunlah seluruh penduduk kota itu di depan pintu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons. He didn’t allow the demons to speak, because they knew him.

block.text: Ia menyembuhkan banyak orang yang menderita bermacam-macam penyakit dan mengusir banyak setan; Ia tidak memperbolehkan setan-setan itu berbicara, sebab mereka mengenal Dia. "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Early in the morning, while it was still dark, he rose up and went out, and departed into a deserted place and prayed there.

block.text: Pagi-pagi benar, waktu hari masih gelap, Ia bangun dan pergi ke luar. Ia pergi ke tempat yang sunyi dan berdoa di sana.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon and those who were with him went to look for him.

block.text: Tetapi Simon dan kawan-kawannya menyusul Dia;

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they found him they said,

block.text: waktu menemukan Dia mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Everyone is looking for you.”

block.text: <<Semua orang mencari Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jawab-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let’s go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also, because I came out for this reason.”

block.text: <<Marilah kita pergi ke tempat lain, ke kota-kota yang berdekatan, supaya di sana juga Aku memberitakan Injil, karena untuk itu Aku telah datang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out demons.

block.text: Lalu pergilah Ia ke seluruh Galilea dan memberitakan Injil dalam rumah-rumah ibadat mereka dan mengusir setan-setan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A leper came to him, begging him, kneeling down to him, and saying to him,

block.text: Seorang yang sakit kusta datang kepada Yesus, dan sambil berlutut di hadapan-Nya ia memohon bantuan-Nya, katanya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you want to, you can make me clean.”

block.text: <<Kalau Engkau mau, Engkau dapat mentahirkan aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being moved with compassion, he stretched out his hand, and touched him, and said to him,

block.text: Maka tergeraklah hati-Nya oleh belas kasihan, lalu Ia mengulurkan tangan-Nya, menjamah orang itu dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want to… Be made clean.”

block.text: <<Aku mau, jadilah engkau tahir.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the leprosy left him and he was cured.

block.text: Seketika itu juga lenyaplah penyakit kusta orang itu, dan ia menjadi tahir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus sent him away at once and warned him strictly,
saying:

block.text: Segera Ia menyuruh orang itu pergi dengan peringatan keras:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “See you say nothing to anybody, but go show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”

block.text: <<Ingatlah, janganlah engkau memberitahukan apa-apa tentang hal ini kepada siapapun, tetapi pergilah, perlihatkanlah dirimu kepada imam dan persembahkanlah untuk pentahiranmu persembahan, yang diperintahkan oleh Musa, sebagai bukti bagi mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he went out, and began to proclaim it much, and to spread about the matter, so that Jesus could no more openly enter into a city, but was outside in desert places: and they came to him from everywhere.

block.text: Tetapi orang itu pergi memberitakan peristiwa itu dan menyebarkannya kemana-mana, sehingga Yesus tidak dapat lagi terang-terangan masuk ke dalam kota. Ia tinggal di luar di tempat-tempat yang sepi; namun orang terus juga datang kepada-Nya dari segala penjuru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 2
When he entered again into Capernaum after some days, it was heard that he was in the house.

block.text: Kemudian, sesudah lewat beberapa hari, waktu Yesus datang lagi ke Kapernaum, tersiarlah kabar, bahwa Ia ada di rumah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no more room, not even around the door; and he spoke the word to them.

block.text: Maka datanglah orang-orang berkerumun sehingga tidak ada lagi tempat, bahkan di muka pintupun tidak. Sementara Ia memberitakan firman kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Four people came, carrying a paralytic to him.

block.text: ada orang-orang datang membawa kepada-Nya seorang lumpuh, digotong oleh empat orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they could not come near to him for the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. When they had broken it up, they let down the mat that the paralytic was lying on.

block.text: Tetapi mereka tidak dapat membawanya kepada-Nya karena orang banyak itu, lalu mereka membuka atap yang di atas-Nya; sesudah terbuka mereka menurunkan tilam, tempat orang lumpuh itu terbaring.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic,

block.text: Ketika Yesus melihat iman mereka, berkatalah Ia kepada orang lumpuh itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Son, your sins are forgiven you.”

block.text: <<Hai anak-Ku, dosamu sudah diampuni!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there were some of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,

block.text: Tetapi di situ ada juga duduk beberapa ahli Taurat, mereka berpikir dalam hatinya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why does this man speak blasphemies like that? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”

block.text: <<Mengapa orang ini berkata begitu? Ia menghujat Allah. Siapa yang dapat mengampuni dosa selain dari pada Allah sendiri?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus segera mengetahui dalam hati-Nya, bahwa mereka berpikir demikian, lalu Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you reason these things in your hearts?

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu berpikir begitu dalam hatimu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which is easier, to tell the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven;’ or to say, ‘Arise, and take up your bed, and walk?’

block.text: Manakah lebih mudah, mengatakan kepada orang lumpuh ini: <Dosamu sudah diampuni,> atau mengatakan: <Bangunlah, angkatlah tilammu dan berjalan?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,”

block.text: Tetapi supaya kamu tahu, bahwa di dunia ini Anak Manusia berkuasa mengampuni dosa>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: --he said to the paralytic—

block.text: —berkatalah Ia kepada orang lumpuh itu—:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, arise, take up your mat, and go to your house.”

block.text: <<Kepadamu Kukatakan, bangunlah, angkatlah tempat tidurmu dan pulanglah ke rumahmu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose, and immediately took up the mat, and went out in front of them all; so that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying,

block.text: Dan orang itupun bangun, segera mengangkat tempat tidurnya dan pergi ke luar di hadapan orang-orang itu, sehingga mereka semua takjub lalu memuliakan Allah, katanya:

block.characterId: everyone who saw healing of paralytic

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: everyone who saw healing of paralytic
ReferenceBlocks.text: “We never saw anything like this!”

block.text: <<Yang begini belum pernah kita lihat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went out again by the seaside. All the multitude came to him, and he taught them.

block.text: Sesudah itu Yesus pergi lagi ke pantai danau, dan seluruh orang banyak datang kepada-Nya, lalu Ia mengajar mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he passed by, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax office, and he said to him,

block.text: Kemudian ketika Ia berjalan lewat di situ, Ia melihat Lewi anak Alfeus duduk di rumah cukai lalu Ia berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me.”

block.text: <<Ikutlah Aku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: And he arose and followed him.

block.text: Maka berdirilah Lewi lalu mengikuti Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, that he was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many, and they followed him.

block.text: Kemudian ketika Yesus makan di rumah orang itu, banyak pemungut cukai dan orang berdosa makan bersama-sama dengan Dia dan murid-murid-Nya, sebab banyak orang yang mengikuti Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The scribes and the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, said to his disciples,

block.text: Pada waktu ahli-ahli Taurat dari golongan Farisi melihat, bahwa Ia makan dengan pemungut cukai dan orang berdosa itu, berkatalah mereka kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why is it that he eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?”

block.text: <<Mengapa Ia makan bersama-sama dengan pemungut cukai dan orang berdosa?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard it, he said to them,

block.text: Yesus mendengarnya dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”

block.text: <<Bukan orang sehat yang memerlukan tabib, tetapi orang sakit; Aku datang bukan untuk memanggil orang benar, melainkan orang berdosa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and they came and asked him,

block.text: Pada suatu kali ketika murid-murid Yohanes dan orang-orang Farisi sedang berpuasa, datanglah orang-orang dan mengatakan kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don’t fast?”

block.text: <<Mengapa murid-murid Yohanes dan murid-murid orang Farisi berpuasa, tetapi murid-murid-Mu tidak?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can the groomsmen fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they can’t fast.

block.text: <<Dapatkah sahabat-sahabat mempelai laki-laki berpuasa sedang mempelai itu bersama mereka? Selama mempelai itu bersama mereka, mereka tidak dapat berpuasa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then will they fast in that day.

block.text: Tetapi waktunya akan datang mempelai itu diambil dari mereka, dan pada waktu itulah mereka akan berpuasa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, or else the patch shrinks and the new tears away from the old, and a worse hole is made.

block.text: Tidak seorangpun menambalkan secarik kain yang belum susut pada baju yang tua, karena jika demikian kain penambal itu akan mencabiknya, yang baru mencabik yang tua, lalu makin besarlah koyaknya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one puts new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and the wine pours out, and the skins will be destroyed; but they put new wine into fresh wineskins.”

block.text: Demikian juga tidak seorangpun mengisikan anggur yang baru ke dalam kantong kulit yang tua, karena jika demikian anggur itu akan mengoyakkan kantong itu, sehingga anggur itu dan kantongnya dua-duanya terbuang. Tetapi anggur yang baru hendaknya disimpan dalam kantong yang baru pula.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that he was going on the Sabbath day through the grain fields, and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of grain.
The Pharisees said to him,

block.text: Pada suatu kali, pada hari Sabat, Yesus berjalan di ladang gandum, dan sementara berjalan murid-murid-Nya memetik bulir gandum.
Maka kata orang-orang Farisi kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, why do they do that which is not lawful on the Sabbath day?”

block.text: <<Lihat! Mengapa mereka berbuat sesuatu yang tidak diperbolehkan pada hari Sabat?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jawab-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Did you never read what David did, when he had need, and was hungry--he, and those who were with him?

block.text: <<Belum pernahkah kamu baca apa yang dilakukan Daud, ketika ia dan mereka yang mengikutinya kekurangan dan kelaparan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the days when Abiathar was high priest, David entered into God’s house and ate the consecrated bread, which is lawful only for the priests to eat. He also gave some to those who were with him?”

block.text: bagaimana ia masuk ke dalam Rumah Allah waktu Abyatar menjabat sebagai Imam Besar lalu makan roti sajian itu—yang tidak boleh dimakan kecuali oleh imam-imam—dan memberinya juga kepada pengikut-pengikutnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.

block.text: <<Hari Sabat diadakan untuk manusia dan bukan manusia untuk hari Sabat,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”

block.text: jadi Anak Manusia adalah juga Tuhan atas hari Sabat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 3
He entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there who had his hand withered.

block.text: Kemudian Yesus masuk lagi ke rumah ibadat. Di situ ada seorang yang mati sebelah tangannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They watched him to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath day, so that they might accuse him.

block.text: Mereka mengamat-amati Yesus, kalau-kalau Ia menyembuhkan orang itu pada hari Sabat, supaya mereka dapat mempersalahkan Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to the man who had the withered hand,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada orang yang mati sebelah tangannya itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stand up.”

block.text: <<Mari, berdirilah di tengah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Kemudian kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful on the Sabbath day to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?”

block.text: <<Manakah yang diperbolehkan pada hari Sabat, berbuat baik atau berbuat jahat, menyelamatkan nyawa orang atau membunuh orang?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they were silent.

block.text: Tetapi mereka itu diam saja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had looked around at them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their hearts, he said to the man,

block.text: Ia berdukacita karena kedegilan mereka dan dengan marah Ia memandang sekeliling-Nya kepada mereka lalu Ia berkata kepada orang itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stretch out your hand.”

block.text: <<Ulurkanlah tanganmu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as healthy as the other.

block.text: Dan ia mengulurkannya, maka sembuhlah tangannya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees went out, and immediately conspired with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

block.text: Lalu keluarlah orang-orang Farisi dan segera bersekongkol dengan orang-orang Herodian untuk membunuh Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus withdrew to the sea with his disciples, and a great multitude followed him from Galilee, from Judea,

block.text: Kemudian Yesus dengan murid-murid-Nya menyingkir ke danau, dan banyak orang dari Galilea mengikuti-Nya. Juga dari Yudea,

ReferenceBlocks.text: from Jerusalem, from Idumaea, beyond the Jordan, and those from around Tyre and Sidon. A great multitude, hearing what great things he did, came to him.

block.text: dari Yerusalem, dari Idumea, dari seberang Yordan, dan dari daerah Tirus dan Sidon datang banyak orang kepada-Nya, sesudah mereka mendengar segala yang dilakukan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke to his disciples that a little boat should stay near him because of the crowd, so that they wouldn’t press on him.

block.text: Ia menyuruh murid-murid-Nya menyediakan sebuah perahu bagi-Nya karena orang banyak itu, supaya mereka jangan sampai menghimpit-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he had healed many, so that as many as had diseases pressed on him that they might touch him.

block.text: Sebab Ia menyembuhkan banyak orang, sehingga semua penderita penyakit berdesak-desakan kepada-Nya hendak menjamah-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, fell down before him, and cried,

block.text: Bilamana roh-roh jahat melihat Dia, mereka jatuh tersungkur di hadapan-Nya dan berteriak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are the Son of God!”

block.text: <<Engkaulah Anak Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sternly warned them, saying:

block.text: Tetapi Ia dengan keras melarang mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not make my presence known.”

block.text: memberitahukan siapa Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went up into the mountain, and called to himself those whom he wanted, and they went to him.

block.text: Kemudian naiklah Yesus ke atas bukit. Ia memanggil orang-orang yang dikehendaki-Nya dan merekapun datang kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He appointed twelve, that they might be with him, and that he might send them out to preach,
and to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons:

block.text: Ia menetapkan dua belas orang untuk menyertai Dia dan untuk diutus-Nya memberitakan Injil
dan diberi-Nya kuasa untuk mengusir setan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon, to whom he gave the name Peter;

block.text: Kedua belas orang yang ditetapkan-Nya itu ialah: Simon, yang diberi-Nya nama Petrus,

ReferenceBlocks.text: James the son of Zebedee; John, the brother of James, and he surnamed them Boanerges, which means, Sons of Thunder;

block.text: Yakobus anak Zebedeus, dan Yohanes saudara Yakobus, yang keduanya diberi-Nya nama Boanerges, yang berarti anak-anak guruh,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Andrew; Philip; Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Thaddaeus; Simon the Zealot;

block.text: selanjutnya Andreas, Filipus, Bartolomeus, Matius, Tomas, Yakobus anak Alfeus, Tadeus, Simon orang Zelot,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him. He came into a house.

block.text: dan Yudas Iskariot, yang mengkhianati Dia. "

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.

block.text: Kemudian Yesus masuk ke sebuah rumah. Maka datanglah orang banyak berkerumun pula, sehingga makanpun mereka tidak dapat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When his friends heard it, they went out to seize him: for they said,

block.text: Waktu kaum keluarga-Nya mendengar hal itu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is insane.”

block.text: mereka datang hendak mengambil Dia, sebab kata mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: The scribes who came down from Jerusalem said,

block.text: Ia tidak waras lagi.
Dan ahli-ahli Taurat yang datang dari Yerusalem berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He has Beelzebul,”

block.text: <<Ia kerasukan Beelzebul,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and,

block.text: dan

ReferenceBlocks.text: “By the prince of the demons he casts out the demons.”

block.text: dengan penghulu setan Ia mengusir setan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He summoned them, and said to them in parables,

block.text: Yesus memanggil mereka, lalu berkata kepada mereka dalam perumpamaan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How can Satan cast out Satan?

block.text: <<Bagaimana Iblis dapat mengusir Iblis?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

block.text: Kalau suatu kerajaan terpecah-pecah, kerajaan itu tidak dapat bertahan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

block.text: dan jika suatu rumah tangga terpecah-pecah, rumah tangga itu tidak dapat bertahan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he can’t stand, but has an end.

block.text: Demikianlah juga kalau Iblis berontak melawan dirinya sendiri dan kalau ia terbagi-bagi, ia tidak dapat bertahan, melainkan sudahlah tiba kesudahannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But no one can enter into the house of the strong man to plunder, unless he first binds the strong man; and then he will plunder his house.

block.text: Tetapi tidak seorangpun dapat memasuki rumah seorang yang kuat untuk merampas harta bendanya apabila tidak diikatnya dahulu orang kuat itu. Sesudah itu barulah dapat ia merampok rumah itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, all the sins and blasphemies of men will be forgiven.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya semua dosa dan hujat anak-anak manusia akan diampuni, ya, semua hujat yang mereka ucapkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But whoever may blaspheme against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is guilty of an eternal sin.”

block.text: Tetapi apabila seorang menghujat Roh Kudus, ia tidak mendapat ampun selama-lamanya, melainkan bersalah karena berbuat dosa kekal.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: --because they said,

block.text: Ia berkata demikian karena mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He has an unclean spirit.”

block.text: katakan bahwa Ia kerasukan roh jahat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His mother and his brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to him, calling him.

block.text: Lalu datanglah ibu dan saudara-saudara Yesus. Sementara mereka berdiri di luar, mereka menyuruh orang memanggil Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A multitude was sitting around him, and they told him,

block.text: Ada orang banyak duduk mengelilingi Dia, mereka berkata kepada-Nya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your mother, your brothers, and your sisters are outside looking for you.”

block.text: <<Lihat, ibu dan saudara-saudara-Mu ada di luar, dan berusaha menemui Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are my mother and my brothers?”

block.text: <<Siapa ibu-Ku dan siapa saudara-saudara-Ku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Looking around at those who sat around him, he said,

block.text: Ia melihat kepada orang-orang yang duduk di sekeliling-Nya itu dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, my mother and my brothers!

block.text: <<Ini ibu-Ku dan saudara-saudara-Ku!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever does the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.”

block.text: Barangsiapa melakukan kehendak Allah, dialah saudara-Ku laki-laki, dialah saudara-Ku perempuan, dialah ibu-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 4
Again he began to teach by the seaside. A great multitude was gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat in the sea, and sat down. All the multitude were on the land by the sea.

block.text: Pada suatu kali Yesus mulai pula mengajar di tepi danau. Maka datanglah orang banyak yang sangat besar jumlahnya mengerumuni Dia, sehingga Ia naik ke sebuah perahu yang sedang berlabuh lalu duduk di situ, sedangkan semua orang banyak itu di darat, di tepi danau itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He taught them many things in parables, and told them in his teaching,

block.text: Dan Ia mengajarkan banyak hal dalam perumpamaan kepada mereka. Dalam ajaran-Nya itu Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Listen! Behold, a farmer went out to sow.

block.text: <<Dengarlah! Adalah seorang penabur keluar untuk menabur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he sowed, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and devoured it.

block.text: Pada waktu ia menabur sebagian benih itu jatuh di pinggir jalan, lalu datanglah burung dan memakannya sampai habis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell on the rocky ground, where it had little soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of soil.

block.text: Sebagian jatuh di tanah yang berbatu-batu, yang tidak banyak tanahnya, lalu benih itupun segera tumbuh, karena tanahnya tipis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the sun had risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

block.text: Tetapi sesudah matahari terbit, layulah ia dan menjadi kering karena tidak berakar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

block.text: Sebagian lagi jatuh di tengah semak duri, lalu makin besarlah semak itu dan menghimpitnya sampai mati, sehingga ia tidak berbuah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing. Some brought forth thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times as much.”

block.text: Dan sebagian jatuh di tanah yang baik, ia tumbuh dengan suburnya dan berbuah, hasilnya ada yang tiga puluh kali lipat, ada yang enam puluh kali lipat, ada yang seratus kali lipat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Dan kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: <<Siapa mempunyai telinga untuk mendengar, hendaklah ia mendengar!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he was alone, those who were around him with the twelve asked him about the parables.
He said to them,

block.text: Ketika Ia sendirian, pengikut-pengikut-Nya dan kedua belas murid itu menanyakan Dia tentang perumpamaan itu.
Jawab-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To you is given the mystery of the Kingdom of God, but to those who are outside, all things are done in parables,

block.text: <<Kepadamu telah diberikan rahasia Kerajaan Allah, tetapi kepada orang-orang luar segala sesuatu disampaikan dalam perumpamaan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: that ’seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest perhaps they should turn again, and their sins should be forgiven them.”

block.text: supaya: Sekalipun melihat, mereka tidak menanggap, sekalipun mendengar, mereka tidak mengerti, supaya mereka jangan berbalik dan mendapat ampun.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Lalu Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t you understand this parable? How will you understand all of the parables?

block.text: <<Tidakkah kamu mengerti perumpamaan ini? Kalau demikian bagaimana kamu dapat memahami semua perumpamaan yang lain?

ReferenceBlocks.text: The farmer sows the word.

block.text: Penabur itu menaburkan firman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The ones by the road are the ones where the word is sown; and when they have heard, immediately Satan comes, and takes away the word which has been sown in them.

block.text: Orang-orang yang di pinggir jalan, tempat firman itu ditaburkan, ialah mereka yang mendengar firman, lalu datanglah Iblis dan mengambil firman yang baru ditaburkan di dalam mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These in the same way are those who are sown on the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with joy.

block.text: Demikian juga yang ditaburkan di tanah yang berbatu-batu, ialah orang-orang yang mendengar firman itu dan segera menerimanya dengan gembira,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They have no root in themselves, but are short-lived. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately they stumble.

block.text: tetapi mereka tidak berakar dan tahan sebentar saja. Apabila kemudian datang penindasan atau penganiayaan karena firman itu, mereka segera murtad.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others are those who are sown among the thorns. These are those who have heard the word,

block.text: Dan yang lain ialah yang ditaburkan di tengah semak duri, itulah yang mendengar firman itu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: but the cares of this age, the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things enter in and choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

block.text: lalu kekuatiran dunia ini dan tipu daya kekayaan dan keinginan-keinginan akan hal yang lain masuklah menghimpit firman itu sehingga tidak berbuah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those which were sown on the good ground are those who hear the word, and accept it, and bear fruit, some thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times.”

block.text: Dan akhirnya yang ditaburkan di tanah yang baik, ialah orang yang mendengar dan menyambut firman itu lalu berbuah, ada yang tiga puluh kali lipat, ada yang enam puluh kali lipat, dan ada yang seratus kali lipat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Lalu Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is the lamp brought to be put under a basket or under a bed? Isn’t it put on a stand?

block.text: <<Orang membawa pelita bukan supaya ditempatkan di bawah gantang atau di bawah tempat tidur, melainkan supaya ditaruh di atas kaki dian.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there is nothing hidden, except that it should be made known; neither was anything made secret, but that it should come to light.

block.text: Sebab tidak ada sesuatu yang tersembunyi yang tidak akan dinyatakan, dan tidak ada sesuatu yang rahasia yang tidak akan tersingkap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If any man has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Barangsiapa mempunyai telinga untuk mendengar, hendaklah ia mendengar!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: La berkata kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take heed what you hear. With whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you, and more will be given to you who hear.

block.text: <<Camkanlah apa yang kamu dengar! Ukuran yang kamu pakai untuk mengukur akan diukurkan kepadamu, dan di samping itu akan ditambah lagi kepadamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever has, to him will more be given, and he who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away from him.”

block.text: Karena siapa yang mempunyai, kepadanya akan diberi, tetapi siapa yang tidak mempunyai, apapun juga yang ada padanya akan diambil dari padanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of God is as if a man should cast seed on the earth.

block.text: <<Beginilah hal Kerajaan Allah itu: seumpama orang yang menaburkan benih di tanah,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Night and day, whether he sleeps or gets up, the seed sprouts and grows, he doesn’t know how.

block.text: lalu pada malam hari ia tidur dan pada siang hari ia bangun, dan benih itu mengeluarkan tunas dan tunas itu makin tinggi, bagaimana terjadinya tidak diketahui orang itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All by itself, the earth bears fruit: first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.

block.text: Bumi dengan sendirinya mengeluarkan buah, mula-mula tangkainya, lalu bulirnya, kemudian butir-butir yang penuh isinya dalam bulir itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the fruit is ripe, immediately he puts forth the sickle, because the harvest has come.”

block.text: Apabila buah itu sudah cukup masak, orang itu segera menyabit, sebab musim menuai sudah tiba.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Kata-Nya lagi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How will we liken the Kingdom of God? Or with what parable will we illustrate it?

block.text: <<Dengan apa hendak kita membandingkan Kerajaan Allah itu, atau dengan perumpamaan manakah hendaknya kita menggambarkannya?

ReferenceBlocks.text: It’s like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, it is less than all the seeds that are on the earth.

block.text: Hal Kerajaan itu seumpama biji sesawi yang ditaburkan di tanah. Memang biji itu yang paling kecil dari pada segala jenis benih yang ada di bumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yet when it is sown, grows up, and becomes greater than all the herbs, and puts out great branches, so that the birds of the sky can lodge under its shadow.”

block.text: Tetapi apabila ia ditaburkan, ia tumbuh dan menjadi lebih besar dari pada segala sayuran yang lain dan mengeluarkan cabang-cabang yang besar, sehingga burung-burung di udara dapat bersarang dalam naungannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: With many such parables he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear it.

block.text: Dalam banyak perumpamaan yang semacam itu Ia memberitakan firman kepada mereka sesuai dengan pengertian mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Without a parable he didn’t speak to them; but privately to his own disciples he explained everything.

block.text: dan tanpa perumpamaan Ia tidak berkata-kata kepada mereka, tetapi kepada murid-murid-Nya Ia menguraikan segala sesuatu secara tersendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On that day, when evening had come, he said to them,

block.text: Pada hari itu, waktu hari sudah petang, Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let’s go over to the other side.”

block.text: <<Marilah kita bertolak ke seberang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Leaving the multitude, they took him with them, even as he was, in the boat. Other small boats were also with him.

block.text: Mereka meninggalkan orang banyak itu lalu bertolak dan membawa Yesus beserta dengan mereka dalam perahu di mana Yesus telah duduk dan perahu-perahu lain juga menyertai Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A big wind storm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so much that the boat was already filled.

block.text: Lalu mengamuklah taufan yang sangat dahsyat dan ombak menyembur masuk ke dalam perahu, sehingga perahu itu mulai penuh dengan air.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion, and they woke him up, and told him,

block.text: Pada waktu itu Yesus sedang tidur di buritan di sebuah tilam. Maka murid-murid-Nya membangunkan Dia dan berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, don’t you care that we are dying?”

block.text: <<Guru, Engkau tidak perduli kalau kita binasa?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He awoke, and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea,

block.text: Iapun bangun, menghardik angin itu dan berkata kepada danau itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace! Be still!”

block.text: <<Diam! Tenanglah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
He said to them,

block.text: Lalu angin itu reda dan danau itu menjadi teduh sekali.
Lalu Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why are you so afraid? How is it that you have no faith?”

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu begitu takut? Mengapa kamu tidak percaya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were greatly afraid, and said to one another,

block.text: Mereka menjadi sangat takut dan berkata seorang kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

block.text: <<Siapa gerangan orang ini, sehingga angin dan danaupun taat kepada-Nya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 5
They came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.

block.text: Lalu sampailah mereka di seberang danau, di daerah orang Gerasa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come out of the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit met him out of the tombs.

block.text: Baru saja Yesus turun dari perahu, datanglah seorang yang kerasukan roh jahat dari pekuburan menemui Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He lived in the tombs. Nobody could bind him any more, not even with chains.

block.text: Orang itu diam di sana dan tidak ada seorangpun lagi yang sanggup mengikatnya, sekalipun dengan rantai,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He had been often bound with fetters and chains, but he tore the chains apart and broke the fetters in pieces. Nobody had the strength to subdue him.

block.text: karena sudah sering ia dibelenggu dan dirantai, tetapi rantainya diputuskannya dan belenggunya dimusnahkannya, sehingga tidak ada seorangpun yang cukup kuat untuk menjinakkannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Always, night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out, and cutting himself with stones.

block.text: Siang malam ia berkeliaran di pekuburan dan di bukit-bukit sambil berteriak-teriak dan memukuli dirinya dengan batu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and bowed down to him,

block.text: Ketika ia melihat Yesus dari jauh, berlarilah ia mendapatkan-Nya lalu menyembah-Nya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and crying out with a loud voice, he said,

block.text: dan dengan keras ia berteriak:

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What have I to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, don’t torment me.”

block.text: <<Hai engkau roh jahat! Keluar dari orang ini!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he said to him,

block.text: Jawab

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”

block.text: <<Apa urusan-Mu dengan aku, hai Yesus, Anak Allah Yang Mahatinggi? Demi Allah, jangan siksa aku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He asked him,

block.text: Kemudian Ia bertanya kepada orang itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is your name?”

block.text: <<Siapa namamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jawabnya:

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “My name is Legion, for we are many.”

block.text: <<Namaku Legion, karena kami banyak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He begged him much, saying:

block.text: Ia memohon dengan sangat supaya Yesus jangan

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not send us out of the region.”

block.text: mengusir roh-roh itu keluar dari daerah itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now on the mountainside there was a great herd of pigs feeding.

block.text: Adalah di sana di lereng bukit sejumlah besar babi sedang mencari makan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the demons begged him, saying,

block.text: lalu roh-roh itu meminta kepada-Nya, katanya:"

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Send us into the pigs, that we may enter into them.”

block.text: <<Suruhlah kami pindah ke dalam babi-babi itu, biarkanlah kami memasukinya!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: At once Jesus gave them permission. The unclean spirits came out
and entered into the pigs. The herd of about two thousand rushed
down the steep bank into the sea,
and they were drowned in the sea.

block.text: Yesus mengabulkan permintaan mereka. Lalu keluarlah
roh-roh jahat itu dan memasuki babi-babi itu. Kawanan babi yang kira-kira dua ribu jumlahnya itu terjun dari
tepi jurang ke dalam danau
dan mati lemas di dalamnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who fed them fled, and told it in the city and in the country. The people came to see what it was that had happened.

block.text: Maka larilah penjaga-penjaga babi itu dan menceriterakan hal itu di kota dan di kampung-kampung sekitarnya. Lalu keluarlah orang untuk melihat apa yang terjadi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to Jesus, and saw him who had been possessed by demons sitting, clothed, and in his right mind, even him who had the legion; and they were afraid.

block.text: Mereka datang kepada Yesus dan melihat orang yang kerasukan itu duduk, sudah berpakaian dan sudah waras, orang yang tadinya kerasukan legion itu. Maka takutlah mereka. "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who saw it told the people what had happened to the demon-posessed man -- and about the pigs.

block.text: Orang-orang yang telah melihat sendiri hal itu menceriterakan kepada mereka tentang apa yang telah terjadi atas orang yang kerasukan setan itu, dan tentang babi-babi itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They began to beg him, saying:

block.text: Lalu mereka mendesak Yesus supaya

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Depart from our borders.”

block.text: Ia meninggalkan daerah mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Jesus was entering into the boat, the man who had been possessed by demons begged him, saying:

block.text: Pada waktu Yesus naik lagi ke dalam perahu, orang yang tadinya kerasukan setan itu meminta, supaya

block.characterId: man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let me go with you.”

block.text: ia diperkenankan menyertai Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He didn’t allow him, but said to him,

block.text: Yesus tidak memperkenankannya, tetapi Ia berkata kepada orang itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go to your house, to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how he had mercy on you.”

block.text: <<Pulanglah ke rumahmu, kepada orang-orang sekampungmu, dan beritahukanlah kepada mereka segala sesuatu yang telah diperbuat oleh Tuhan atasmu dan bagaimana Ia telah mengasihani engkau!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went his way, and began to proclaim in Decapolis how Jesus had done great things for him, and everyone marveled.

block.text: Orang itupun pergilah dan mulai memberitakan di daerah Dekapolis segala apa yang telah diperbuat Yesus atas dirinya dan mereka semua menjadi heran.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus had crossed back over in the boat to the other side, a great multitude was gathered to him; and he was by the sea.

block.text: Sesudah Yesus menyeberang lagi dengan perahu, orang banyak berbondong-bondong datang lalu mengerumuni Dia. Sedang Ia berada di tepi danau,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name, came; and seeing him, he fell at his feet,

block.text: datanglah seorang kepala rumah ibadat yang bernama Yairus. Ketika ia melihat Yesus, tersungkurlah ia di depan kaki-Nya

ReferenceBlocks.text: and begged him much, saying,

block.text: dan memohon dengan sangat kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My little daughter is at the point of death. Please come and lay your hands on her, that she may be made healthy, and live.”

block.text: <<Anakku perempuan sedang sakit, hampir mati, datanglah kiranya dan letakkanlah tangan-Mu atasnya, supaya ia selamat dan tetap hidup.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went with him, and a great multitude followed him, and they pressed upon him on all sides.

block.text: Lalu pergilah Yesus dengan orang itu. Orang banyak berbondong-bondong mengikuti Dia dan berdesak-desakan di dekat-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain woman, who had an issue of blood for twelve years.

block.text: Adalah di situ seorang perempuan yang sudah dua belas tahun lamanya menderita pendarahan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She had suffered many things by many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was no better, but rather grew worse.

block.text: Ia telah berulang-ulang diobati oleh berbagai tabib, sehingga telah dihabiskannya semua yang ada padanya, namun sama sekali tidak ada faedahnya malah sebaliknya keadaannya makin memburuk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having heard the things concerning Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd, and touched his clothes.
For she said,

block.text: Dia sudah mendengar berita-berita tentang Yesus, maka di tengah-tengah orang banyak itu ia mendekati Yesus dari belakang dan menjamah jubah-Nya.
Sebab katanya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I just touch his clothes, I will be made well.”

block.text: <<Asal kujamah saja jubah-Nya, aku akan sembuh.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction.

block.text: Seketika itu juga berhentilah pendarahannya dan ia merasa, bahwa badannya sudah sembuh dari penyakitnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in himself that the power had gone out from him, turned around in the crowd, and asked,

block.text: Pada ketika itu juga Yesus mengetahui, bahwa ada tenaga yang keluar dari diri-Nya, lalu Ia berpaling di tengah orang banyak dan bertanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who touched my clothes?”

block.text: <<Siapa yang menjamah jubah-Ku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples said to him,

block.text: Murid-murid-Nya menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You see the multitude pressing against you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”

block.text: <<Engkau melihat bagaimana orang-orang ini berdesak-desakan dekat-Mu, dan Engkau bertanya: <Siapa yang menjamah Aku?> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He looked around to see her who had done this thing.

block.text: Lalu Ia memandang sekeliling-Nya untuk melihat siapa yang telah melakukan hal itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
He said to her,

block.text: Perempuan itu, yang menjadi takut dan gemetar ketika mengetahui apa yang telah terjadi atas dirinya, tampil dan tersungkur di depan Yesus dan dengan tulus memberitahukan segala sesuatu kepada-Nya.
Maka kata-Nya kepada perempuan itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be cured of your disease.”

block.text: <<Hai anak-Ku, imanmu telah menyelamatkan engkau. Pergilah dengan selamat dan sembuhlah dari penyakitmu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was still speaking, people came from the synagogue ruler’s house saying,

block.text: Ketika Yesus masih berbicara datanglah orang dari keluarga kepala rumah ibadat itu dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher any more?”

block.text: <<Anakmu sudah mati, apa perlunya lagi engkau menyusah-nyusahkan Guru?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus, when he heard the message spoken, immediately said to the ruler of the synagogue,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus tidak menghiraukan perkataan mereka dan berkata kepada kepala rumah ibadat:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t be afraid, only believe.”

block.text: <<Jangan takut, percaya saja!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He allowed no one to follow him, except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.

block.text: Lalu Yesus tidak memperbolehkan seorangpun ikut serta, kecuali Petrus, Yakobus dan Yohanes, saudara Yakobus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to the synagogue ruler’s house, and he saw an uproar, weeping, and great wailing.

block.text: Mereka tiba di rumah kepala rumah ibadat, dan di sana dilihat-Nya orang-orang ribut, menangis dan meratap dengan suara nyaring.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had entered in, he said to them,

block.text: Sesudah Ia masuk Ia berkata kepada orang-orang itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you make an uproar and weep? The child is not dead, but is asleep.”

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu ribut dan menangis? Anak ini tidak mati, tetapi tidur!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they laughed at him. After he put them all out of the room, he took the father of the child, her mother, and those who were with him, and went in where the child was lying.

block.text: Tapi mereka menertawakannya. Maka diusir-Nya semua orang itu, lalu dibawa-Nya ayah dan ibu anak itu dan mereka yang bersama-sama dengan Dia masuk ke kamar anak itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Taking the child by the hand, he said to her,

block.text: Lalu dipegang-Nya tangan anak itu, kata-Nya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Talitha cumi!”

block.text: <<Talita kum,>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: which means, being interpreted,

block.text: yang berarti:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Little girl, I say to you, get up!”

block.text: <<Hai anak, Aku berkata kepadamu, bangunlah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the girl rose up and walked, for she was twelve years old. They were amazed with great amazement.

block.text: Seketika itu juga anak itu bangkit berdiri dan berjalan, sebab umurnya sudah dua belas tahun. Semua orang yang hadir sangat takjub.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He strictly ordered them, saying:

block.text: Dengan sangat Ia berpesan kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one about this!”

block.text: supaya jangan seorangpun

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said:

block.text: mengetahui hal itu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give her something to eat.”

block.text: lalu Ia menyuruh mereka memberi anak itu makan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 6
He went out from there. He came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.

block.text: Kemudian Yesus berangkat dari situ dan tiba di tempat asal-Nya, sedang murid-murid-Nya mengikuti Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Sabbath had come, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many hearing him were astonished, saying,

block.text: Pada hari Sabat Ia mulai mengajar di rumah ibadat dan jemaat yang besar takjub ketika mendengar Dia dan mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where did this man get these things?” and, “What is the wisdom that is given to this man, that such mighty works come about by his hands?

block.text: <<Dari mana diperoleh-Nya semuanya itu? Hikmat apa pulakah yang diberikan kepada-Nya? Dan mujizat-mujizat yang demikian bagaimanakah dapat diadakan oleh tangan-Nya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Isn’t this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, Joses, Judah, and Simon? Aren’t his sisters here with us?”

block.text: <<Bukankah Ia ini tukang kayu, anak Maria, saudara Yakobus, Yoses, Yudas dan Simon? Dan bukankah saudara-saudara-Nya yang perempuan ada bersama kita?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were offended at him.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Lalu mereka kecewa dan menolak Dia.
Maka Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and among his own relatives, and in his own house.”

block.text: <<Seorang nabi dihormati di mana-mana kecuali di tempat asalnya sendiri, di antara kaum keluarganya dan di rumahnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He could do no mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people, and healed them.

block.text: Ia tidak dapat mengadakan satu mujizatpun di sana, kecuali menyembuhkan beberapa orang sakit dengan meletakkan tangan-Nya atas mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He marveled because of their unbelief. He went around the villages teaching.

block.text: Ia merasa heran atas ketidakpercayaan mereka. Lalu Yesus berjalan keliling dari desa ke desa sambil mengajar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called to himself the twelve, and said to them:

block.text: Ia memanggil kedua belas murid itu dan mengutus mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am sending you out two by two and I am giving you authority over the unclean spirits”

block.text: berdua-dua. Ia memberi mereka kuasa atas roh-roh jahat,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he told them:

block.text: dan berpesan kepada mereka supaya

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take nothing for your journey, except a staff: no bread, no wallet, no money in your purse.

block.text: jangan membawa apa-apa dalam perjalanan mereka, kecuali tongkat, rotipun jangan, bekalpun jangan, uang dalam ikat pinggangpun jangan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Wear sandals, but only one tunic.”

block.text: boleh memakai alas kaki, tetapi jangan memakai dua baju.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Kata-Nya selanjutnya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Wherever you enter into a house, stay there until you depart from there.

block.text: <<Kalau di suatu tempat kamu sudah diterima dalam suatu rumah, tinggallah di situ sampai kamu berangkat dari tempat itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever will not receive you nor hear you, as you depart from there, shake off the dust that is under your feet for a testimony against them. Assuredly, I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!”

block.text: Dan kalau ada suatu tempat yang tidak mau menerima kamu dan kalau mereka tidak mau mendengarkan kamu, keluarlah dari situ dan kebaskanlah debu yang di kakimu sebagai peringatan bagi mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went out and preached that people should repent.

block.text: Lalu pergilah mereka memberitakan bahwa orang harus bertobat,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They cast out many demons, and anointed many with oil who were sick, and healed them.

block.text: dan mereka mengusir banyak setan, dan mengoles banyak orang sakit dengan minyak dan menyembuhkan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: King Herod heard this, for his name had become known, and he said,

block.text: Raja Herodes juga mendengar tentang Yesus, sebab nama-Nya sudah terkenal dan orang mengatakan:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John the Baptizer has risen from the dead, and therefore these powers are at work in him.”

block.text: <<Yohanes Pembaptis sudah bangkit dari antara orang mati dan itulah sebabnya kuasa-kuasa itu bekerja di dalam Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But others said,

block.text: Yang lain mengatakan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is Elijah.”

block.text: <<Dia itu Elia!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others said,

block.text: Yang lain lagi mengatakan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is a prophet, or like one of the prophets.”

block.text: <<Dia itu seorang nabi sama seperti nabi-nabi yang dahulu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Herod, when he heard this, said,

block.text: Waktu Herodes mendengar hal itu, ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is John, whom I beheaded. He has risen from the dead.”

block.text: <<Bukan, dia itu Yohanes yang sudah kupenggal kepalanya, dan yang bangkit lagi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod himself had given orders to have John arrested and put in prison. He did this because he had married Herodius, his brother Philip’s wife.

block.text: Sebab memang Herodeslah yang menyuruh orang menangkap Yohanes dan membelenggunya di penjara berhubung dengan peristiwa Herodias, isteri Filipus saudaranya, karena Herodes telah mengambilnya sebagai isteri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John had been saying to Herod:

block.text: Karena Yohanes pernah menegor Herodes:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”

block.text: <<Tidak halal engkau mengambil isteri saudaramu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herodias set herself against him, and desired to kill him, but she couldn’t.

block.text: Karena itu Herodias menaruh dendam pada Yohanes dan bermaksud untuk membunuh dia, tetapi tidak dapat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Herod feared John. He knew that John was a righteous and holy man and so he kept him safe. When he heard him, he did many things, and he heard him gladly.

block.text: Sebab Herodes segan akan Yohanes karena ia tahu, bahwa Yohanes adalah orang yang benar dan suci, jadi ia melindunginya. Tetapi apabila ia mendengarkan Yohanes, hatinya selalu terombang-ambing, namun ia merasa senang juga mendengarkan dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then a convenient day came, that Herod on his birthday made a supper for his nobles, the high officers, and the chief men of Galilee.

block.text: Akhirnya tiba juga kesempatan yang baik bagi Herodias, ketika Herodes pada hari ulang tahunnya mengadakan perjamuan untuk pembesar-pembesarny perwira-perwiranya dan orang-orang terkemuka di Galilea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced, she pleased Herod and those sitting with him. The king said to the young lady,

block.text: Pada waktu itu anak perempuan Herodias tampil lalu menari, dan ia menyukakan hati Herodes dan tamu-tamunya. Raja berkata kepada gadis itu:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you.”

block.text: <<Minta dari padaku apa saja yang kauingini, maka akan kuberikan kepadamu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He swore to her,

block.text: lalu bersumpah kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whatever you shall ask of me, I will give you, up to half of my kingdom.”

block.text: <<Apa saja yang kauminta akan kuberikan kepadamu, sekalipun setengah dari kerajaanku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She went out, and said to her mother,

block.text: Anak itu pergi dan menanyakan ibunya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What shall I ask?”

block.text: <<Apa yang harus kuminta?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The head of John the Baptizer.”

block.text: <<Kepala Yohanes Pembaptis!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She came in immediately with haste to the king, and asked,

block.text: Maka cepat-cepat ia pergi kepada raja dan meminta:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptizer on a platter.”

block.text: <<Aku mau, supaya sekarang juga engkau berikan kepadaku kepala Yohanes Pembaptis di sebuah talam!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The king was exceedingly sorry, but for the sake of his oaths, and of his dinner guests, he didn’t wish to refuse her.

block.text: Lalu sangat sedihlah hati raja, tetapi karena sumpahnya dan karena tamu-tamunya ia tidak mau menolaknya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the king sent out a soldier of his guard, and commanded to bring John’s head, and he went and beheaded him in the prison,

block.text: Raja segera menyuruh seorang pengawal dengan perintah supaya mengambil kepala Yohanes. Orang itu pergi dan memenggal kepala Yohanes di penjara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the young lady; and the young lady gave it to her mother.

block.text: Ia membawa kepala itu di sebuah talam dan memberikannya kepada gadis itu dan gadis itu memberikannya pula kepada ibunya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When his disciples heard this, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.

block.text: Ketika murid-murid Yohanes mendengar hal itu mereka datang dan mengambil mayatnya, lalu membaringkannya dalam kuburan. "

ReferenceBlocks.text: The apostles gathered themselves together to Jesus, and they told him all things, whatever they had done, and whatever they had taught.
He said to them,

block.text: Para rasul itu berkumpul kepada Yesus, dan mereka menceritakan segala sesuatu, apa pun yang mereka lakukan, dan apa pun mereka telah diajarkan.
Dia berkata kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come with me to a deserted place, and rest awhile.”

block.text: <<Marilah ke tempat yang sunyi, supaya kita sendirian, dan beristirahatlah seketika!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.

block.text: Untuk ada banyak datang dan pergi, dan mereka tidak punya waktu luang begitu banyak seperti untuk makan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went away in the boat to a deserted place by themselves.

block.text: Maka berangkatlah mereka untuk mengasingkan diri dengan perahu ke tempat yang sunyi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They saw them going, and many recognized him and ran there on foot from all the cities. They arrived before them and came together to him.

block.text: Tetapi pada waktu mereka bertolak banyak orang melihat mereka dan mengetahui tujuan mereka. Dengan mengambil jalan darat segeralah datang orang dari semua kota ke tempat itu sehingga mendahului mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus came out, saw a great multitude, and he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd, and he began to teach them many things.

block.text: Ketika Yesus mendarat, Ia melihat sejumlah besar orang banyak, maka tergeraklah hati-Nya oleh belas kasihan kepada mereka, karena mereka seperti domba yang tidak mempunyai gembala. Lalu mulailah Ia mengajarkan banyak hal kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was late in the day, his disciples came to him, and said,

block.text: Pada waktu hari sudah mulai malam, datanglah murid-murid-Nya kepada-Nya dan berkata:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This place is deserted, and it is late in the day.

block.text: <<Tempat ini sunyi dan hari sudah mulai malam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Send them away, that they may go into the surrounding country and villages, and buy themselves bread, for they have nothing to eat.”

block.text: Suruhlah mereka pergi, supaya mereka dapat membeli makanan di desa-desa dan di kampung-kampung di sekitar ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: Tetapi jawab-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You give them something to eat.”

block.text: <<Kamu harus memberi mereka makan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him,

block.text: Kata mereka kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread, and give them something to eat?”

block.text: <<Jadi haruskah kami membeli roti seharga dua ratus dinar untuk memberi mereka makan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How many loaves do you have? Go see.”

block.text: <<Berapa banyak roti yang ada padamu? Cobalah periksa!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they knew, they said,

block.text: Sesudah memeriksanya mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Five, and two fish.”

block.text: <<Lima roti dan dua ikan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded his disciples, saying:

block.text: Lalu Ia menyuruh orang-orang itu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell everyone to sit down in groups on the green grass.”

block.text: supaya semua duduk berkelompok-kelompok di atas rumput hijau.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They sat down in ranks, by hundreds and by fifties.

block.text: Maka duduklah mereka berkelompok-kelompok, ada yang seratus, ada yang lima puluh orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed and broke the loaves, and he gave to his disciples to set before them, and he divided the two fish among them all.

block.text: Dan setelah Ia mengambil lima roti dan dua ikan itu, Ia menengadah ke langit dan mengucap berkat, lalu memecah-mecahkan roti itu dan memberikannya kepada murid-murid-Nya, supaya dibagi-bagikan kepada orang-orang itu; begitu juga kedua ikan itu dibagi-bagikan-Nya kepada semua mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all ate, and were filled.

block.text: Dan mereka semuanya makan sampai kenyang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took up twelve baskets full of broken pieces and also of the fish.

block.text: Kemudian orang mengumpulkan potongan-potongan roti dua belas bakul penuh, selain dari pada sisa-sisa ikan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who ate the loaves were five thousand men.

block.text: Yang ikut makan roti itu ada lima ribu orang laki-laki.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he ordered his disciples:

block.text: Sesudah itu Yesus segera memerintahkan murid-murid-Nya naik ke

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get into the boat and go to the other side, to Bethsaida.”

block.text: perahu dan berangkat lebih dulu ke seberang, ke Betsaida,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus sent the multitude away.

block.text: sementara itu Ia menyuruh orang banyak pulang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After he had taken leave of them, he went up the mountain to pray.

block.text: Setelah Ia berpisah dari mereka, Ia pergi ke bukit untuk berdoa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening had come, the boat was in the midst of the sea, and he was alone on the land.

block.text: Ketika hari sudah malam perahu itu sudah di tengah danau, sedang Yesus tinggal sendirian di darat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing them distressed in rowing, for the wind was contrary to them, about the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea, and he would have passed by them.

block.text: Ketika Ia melihat betapa payahnya mereka mendayung karena angin sakal, maka kira-kira jam tiga malam Ia datang kepada mereka berjalan di atas air dan Ia hendak melewati mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they saw him walking on the sea, they cried out:

block.text: Ketika mereka melihat Dia berjalan di atas air, mereka berteriak-teriak,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It’s a ghost!”

block.text: "Itu hantu!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: for they all saw him, and were troubled. But he immediately spoke with them, and said to them,

block.text: sebab mereka semua melihat Dia dan merekapun sangat terkejut. Tetapi segera Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cheer up! It is I! Don’t be afraid.”

block.text: <<Tenanglah! Aku ini, jangan takut!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He got into the boat with them; and the wind ceased, and they were very amazed among themselves, and marveled;

block.text: Lalu Ia naik ke perahu mendapatkan mereka, dan anginpun redalah. Mereka sangat tercengang dan bingung,

ReferenceBlocks.text: for they hadn’t understood about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.

block.text: sebab sesudah peristiwa roti itu mereka belum juga mengerti, dan hati mereka tetap degil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret, and moored to the shore.

block.text: Setibanya di seberang Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya mendarat di Genesaret dan berlabuh di situ

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come out of the boat, immediately the people recognized him.

block.text: Ketika mereka keluar dari perahu, orang segera mengenal Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ran around that whole region, and began to bring those who were sick, on their mats, to wherever they heard people say:

block.text: Maka berlari-larilah mereka ke seluruh daerah itu dan mulai mengusung orang-orang sakit di atas tilamnya kepada

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus is here.”

block.text: Yesus, di mana saja kabarnya Ia berada.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Wherever he entered, into villages, or into cities, or into the country, they laid the sick in the marketplaces, and begged him, saying:

block.text: Ke manapun Ia pergi, ke desa-desa, ke kota-kota, atau ke kampung-kampung, orang meletakkan orang-orang sakit di pasar dan memohon kepada-Nya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Just let me touch the fringe of your garment!”

block.text: supaya mereka diperkenankan hanya menjamah jumbai jubah-Nya saja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And all those who touched him were healed.

block.text: Dan semua orang yang menjamah-Nya menjadi sembuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 7
Then the Pharisees, and some of the scribes gathered together to him, having come from Jerusalem.

block.text: Pada suatu kali serombongan orang Farisi dan beberapa ahli Taurat dari Yerusalem datang menemui Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they saw some of his disciples eating bread with defiled, that is, unwashed, hands, they found fault.

block.text: Mereka melihat, bahwa beberapa orang murid-Nya makan dengan tangan najis, yaitu dengan tangan yang tidak dibasuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, don’t eat unless they wash their hands and forearms, holding to the tradition of the elders.

block.text: Sebab orang-orang Farisi seperti orang-orang Yahudi lainnya tidak makan kalau tidak melakukan pembasuhan tangan lebih dulu, karena mereka berpegang pada adat istiadat nenek moyang mereka;

ReferenceBlocks.text: They don’t eat when they come from the marketplace, unless they bathe themselves, and there are many other things, which they have received to hold to: washings of cups, pitchers, bronze vessels, and couches.)

block.text: dan kalau pulang dari pasar mereka juga tidak makan kalau tidak lebih dahulu membersihkan dirinya. Banyak warisan lain lagi yang mereka pegang, umpamanya hal mencuci cawan, kendi dan perkakas-perkakas tembaga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees and the scribes asked him,

block.text: Karena itu orang-orang Farisi dan ahli-ahli Taurat itu bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why don’t your disciples walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with unwashed hands?”

block.text: <<Mengapa murid-murid-Mu tidak hidup menurut adat istiadat nenek moyang kita, tetapi makan dengan tangan najis?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Jawab-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written, ‘This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

block.text: <<Benarlah nubuat Yesaya tentang kamu, hai orang-orang munafik! Sebab ada tertulis: <Bangsa ini memuliakan Aku dengan bibirnya, padahal hatinya jauh dari pada-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But in vain do they worship me, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”

block.text: Percuma mereka beribadah kepada-Ku, sedangkan ajaran yang mereka ajarkan ialah perintah manusia.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For you set aside the commandment of God, and hold tightly to the tradition of men--the washing of pitchers and cups, and you do many other such things.”

block.text: Perintah Allah kamu abaikan untuk berpegang pada adat istiadat manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: La berkata kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Full well do you reject the commandment of God, that you may keep your tradition.

block.text: <<Sungguh pandai kamu mengesampingkan perintah Allah, supaya kamu dapat memelihara adat istiadatmu sendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother;’ and, ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him be put to death.’

block.text: Karena Musa telah berkata: <Hormatilah ayahmu dan ibumu! dan: Siapa yang mengutuki ayahnya atau ibunya harus mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you say, ‘If a man tells his father or his mother, “Whatever profit you might have received from me is Corban, that is to say, given to God”’;

block.text: Tetapi kamu berkata: Kalau seorang berkata kepada bapanya atau ibunya: Apa yang ada padaku, yang dapat digunakan untuk pemeliharaanmu, sudah digunakan untuk korban—yaitu persembahan kepada Allah—,

ReferenceBlocks.text: then you no longer allow him to do anything for his father or his mother.

block.text: maka kamu tidak membiarkannya lagi berbuat sesuatupun untuk bapanya atau ibunya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You make void the word of God by your tradition, which you have handed down. You do many things like this.”

block.text: Dengan demikian firman Allah kamu nyatakan tidak berlaku demi adat istiadat yang kamu ikuti itu. Dan banyak hal lain seperti itu yang kamu lakukan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called all the multitude to himself, and said to them,

block.text: Lalu Yesus memanggil lagi orang banyak dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hear me, all of you, and understand.

block.text: <<Kamu semua, dengarlah kepada-Ku dan camkanlah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There is nothing from outside of the man, that going into him can defile him; but the things which proceed out of the man are those that defile the man.

block.text: Apapun dari luar, yang masuk ke dalam seseorang, tidak dapat menajiskannya, tetapi apa yang keluar dari seseorang, itulah yang menajiskannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!”

block.text: (Barangsiapa bertelinga untuk mendengar hendaklah ia mendengar!)>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had entered into a house away from the multitude, his disciples asked him about the parable.
He said to them,

block.text: Sesudah Ia masuk ke sebuah rumah untuk menyingkir dari orang banyak, murid-murid-Nya bertanya kepada-Nya tentang arti perumpamaan itu.
Maka jawab-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you thus without understanding also? Don’t you see that whatever goes into a man from outside can’t defile him?

block.text: <<Apakah kamu juga tidak dapat memahaminya? Tidak tahukah kamu bahwa segala sesuatu dari luar yang masuk ke dalam seseorang tidak dapat menajiskannya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is because it doesn’t go into his heart, but into his stomach, then into the latrine, thus purifying all foods.”

block.text: karena bukan masuk ke dalam hati tetapi ke dalam perutnya, lalu dibuang di jamban?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thus he declared all foods clean
Jesus also said,

block.text: Dengan demikian Ia menyatakan semua makanan halal.
Kata-Nya lagi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “That which proceeds out of a man, that is what defiles a man.

block.text: <<Apa yang keluar dari seseorang, itulah yang menajiskannya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For from within, out of the hearts of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, sexual sins, murders, thefts,

block.text: sebab dari dalam, dari hati orang, timbul segala pikiran jahat, percabulan, pencurian, pembunuhan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: covetings, wickedness, deceit, lustful desires, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, and foolishness.

block.text: perzinahan, keserakahan, kejahatan, kelicikan, hawa nafsu, iri hati, hujat, kesombongan, kebebalan.
