ReferenceBlocks.text: All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.”

block.text: Semua hal-hal jahat ini timbul dari dalam dan menajiskan orang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: From there he arose, and went away into the borders of Tyre and Sidon. He entered into a house, and didn’t want anyone to know it, but he couldn’t escape notice.

block.text: Lalu Yesus berangkat dari situ dan pergi ke daerah Tirus. Ia masuk ke sebuah rumah dan tidak mau bahwa ada orang yang mengetahuinya, tetapi kedatangan-Nya tidak dapat dirahasiakan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For a woman, whose little daughter had an unclean spirit, having heard of him, came and fell down at his feet.

block.text: Malah seorang ibu, yang anaknya perempuan kerasukan roh jahat, segera mendengar tentang Dia, lalu datang dan tersungkur di depan kaki-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by race. She begged him, saying:

block.text: Perempuan itu seorang Yunani bangsa Siro-Fenisia. Ia memohon kepada Yesus

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Please cast the demon out of my daughter!”

block.text: untuk mengusir setan itu dari anaknya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to her,

block.text: Lalu Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let the children be filled first, for it is not appropriate to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”

block.text: <<Biarlah anak-anak kenyang dahulu, sebab tidak patut mengambil roti yang disediakan bagi anak-anak dan melemparkannya kepada anjing.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But she answered him,

block.text: Tetapi perempuan itu menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord. Yet even the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”

block.text: <<Benar, Tuhan. Tetapi anjing yang di bawah meja juga makan remah-remah yang dijatuhkan anak-anak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to her,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus kepada perempuan itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For this saying, go your way. The demon has gone out of your daughter.”

block.text: <<Karena kata-katamu itu, pergilah sekarang sebab setan itu sudah keluar dari anakmu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She went away to her house, and found the child having been laid on the bed, with the demon gone out.

block.text: Perempuan itu pulang ke rumahnya, lalu didapatinya anak itu berbaring di tempat tidur, sedang setan itu sudah keluar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he departed from the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and came to the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the region of Decapolis.

block.text: Kemudian Yesus meninggalkan pula daerah Tirus dan dengan melalui Sidon pergi ke danau Galilea, di tengah-tengah daerah Dekapolis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought to him one who was deaf and had an impediment in his speech. They begged him to lay his hand on him.

block.text: Di situ orang membawa kepada-Nya seorang yang tuli dan yang gagap dan memohon kepada-Nya, supaya Ia meletakkan tangan-Nya atas orang itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took him aside from the multitude, privately, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spat, and touched his tongue.

block.text: Dan sesudah Yesus memisahkan dia dari orang banyak, sehingga mereka sendirian, Ia memasukkan jari-Nya ke telinga orang itu, lalu Ia meludah dan meraba lidah orang itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Looking up to heaven, he sighed, and said to him,

block.text: Kemudian sambil menengadah ke langit Yesus menarik nafas dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ephphatha!”

block.text: <<Efata!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: that is,

block.text: artinya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be opened!”

block.text: <<Terbukalah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was released, and he spoke clearly.

block.text: Maka terbukalah telinga orang itu dan seketika itu terlepas pulalah pengikat lidahnya, lalu ia berkata-kata dengan baik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded them, saying:

block.text: Yesus berpesan kepada orang-orang yang ada di situ

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one of this.”

block.text: supaya jangan menceriterakannya kepada siapapun juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the more he told them not to proclaim it, the more widely they did proclaim it.

block.text: Tetapi makin dilarang-Nya mereka, makin luas mereka memberitakannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were astonished beyond measure, saying,

block.text: Mereka takjub dan tercengang dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He has done all things well. He makes even the deaf hear, and the mute speak!”

block.text: <<Ia menjadikan segala-galanya baik, yang tuli dijadikan-Nya mendengar, yang bisu dijadikan-Nya berkata-kata.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 8
In those days, when there was a very great multitude, and they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to himself, and said to them,

block.text: Pada waktu itu ada pula orang banyak di situ yang besar jumlahnya, dan karena mereka tidak mempunyai makanan, Yesus memanggil murid-murid-Nya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have compassion on the multitude, because they have stayed with me now three days, and have nothing to eat.

block.text: <<Hati-Ku tergerak oleh belas kasihan kepada orang banyak ini. Sudah tiga hari mereka mengikuti Aku dan mereka tidak mempunyai makanan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If I send them away fasting to their home, they will faint on the way, for some of them have come a long way.”

block.text: Dan jika mereka Kusuruh pulang ke rumahnya dengan lapar, mereka akan rebah di jalan, sebab ada yang datang dari jauh.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples answered him,

block.text: Murid-murid-Nya menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “From where could one satisfy these people with bread here in a deserted place?”

block.text: <<Bagaimana di tempat yang sunyi ini orang dapat memberi mereka roti sampai kenyang?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He asked them,

block.text: Yesus bertanya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How many loaves do you have?”

block.text: <<Berapa roti ada padamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Seven.”

block.text: <<Tujuh.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the multitude, saying:

block.text: Lalu Ia menyuruh orang

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sit down on the ground.”

block.text: banyak itu duduk di tanah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then, taking the seven loaves, he gave thanks and then broke them and gave them to his disciples to give to the people, and they did so.

block.text: Sesudah itu Ia mengambil ketujuh roti itu, mengucap syukur, memecah-mecahkannya dan memberikannya kepada murid-murid-Nya untuk dibagi-bagikan, dan mereka memberikannya kepada orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They had a few small fish. Having blessed them, he said to give them to the people as well.

block.text: Mereka juga mempunyai beberapa ikan, dan sesudah mengucap berkat atasnya, Ia menyuruh supaya ikan itu juga dibagi-bagikan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ate, and were filled. They took up seven baskets of broken pieces that were left over.

block.text: Dan mereka makan sampai kenyang. Kemudian orang mengumpulkan potongan-potongan roti yang sisa, sebanyak tujuh bakul.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who had eaten were about four thousand. Then he sent them away.

block.text: Mereka itu ada kira-kira empat ribu orang. Lalu Yesus menyuruh mereka pulang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he entered into the boat with his disciples, and came into the region of Dalmanutha.

block.text: Ia segera naik ke perahu dengan murid-murid-Nya dan bertolak ke daerah Dalmanuta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees came and began to question him. To test him they said:

block.text: Lalu muncullah orang-orang Farisi dan bersoal jawab dengan Yesus. Untuk mencobai Dia mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Show us a sign from Heaven!”

block.text: meminta dari pada-Nya suatu tanda dari sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sighed deeply in his spirit, and said,

block.text: Maka mengeluhlah Ia dalam hati-Nya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why does this generation seek a sign? Most certainly I tell you, no sign will be given to this generation.”

block.text: <<Mengapa angkatan ini meminta tanda? Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya kepada angkatan ini sekali-kali tidak akan diberi tanda.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He left them, and again entering into the boat, departed to the other side.

block.text: Ia meninggalkan mereka; Ia naik pula ke perahu dan bertolak ke seberang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They forgot to take bread; and they didn’t have more than one loaf in the boat with them.
He warned them, saying,

block.text: Kemudian ternyata murid-murid Yesus lupa membawa roti, hanya sebuah saja yang ada pada mereka dalam perahu.
Lalu Yesus memperingatkan mereka, kata-Nya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take heed: beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”

block.text: <<Berjaga-jagalah dan awaslah terhadap ragi orang Farisi dan ragi Herodes.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned with one another, saying,

block.text: Maka mereka berpikir-pikir dan seorang berkata kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It’s because we have no bread.”

block.text: <<Itu dikatakan-Nya karena kita tidak mempunyai roti.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, perceiving it, said to them,

block.text: Dan ketika Yesus mengetahui apa yang mereka perbincangkan, Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you reason that it’s because you have no bread? Don’t you perceive yet, neither understand? Is your heart still hardened?

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu memperbincangkan soal tidak ada roti? Belum jugakah kamu faham dan mengerti? Telah degilkah hatimu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having eyes, don’t you see? Having ears, don’t you hear? Don’t you remember?

block.text: Kamu mempunyai mata, tidakkah kamu melihat dan kamu mempunyai telinga, tidakkah kamu mendengar? Tidakkah kamu ingat lagi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I broke the five loaves among the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?”

block.text: pada waktu Aku memecah-mecahkan lima roti untuk lima ribu orang itu, berapa bakul penuh potongan-potongan roti kamu kumpulkan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Twelve.”

block.text: <<Dua belas bakul.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When the seven loaves fed the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?”

block.text: <<Dan pada waktu tujuh roti untuk empat ribu orang itu, berapa bakul penuh potongan-potongan roti kamu kumpulkan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Seven.”

block.text: <<Tujuh bakul.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He asked them,

block.text: Lalu kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t you understand, yet?”

block.text: <<Masihkah kamu belum mengerti?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to him, and begged him to touch him.

block.text: Kemudian tibalah Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya di Betsaida. Di situ orang membawa kepada Yesus seorang buta dan mereka memohon kepada-Nya, supaya Ia menjamah dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took hold of the blind man by the hand, and brought him out of the village. When he had spit on his eyes, and laid his hands on him,

block.text: Yesus memegang tangan orang buta itu dan membawa dia ke luar kampung. Lalu Ia meludahi mata orang itu dan meletakkan tangan-Nya atasnya, dan bertanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you see anything?”

block.text: <<Sudahkah kaulihat sesuatu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He looked up, and said,

block.text: Orang itu memandang ke depan, lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I see men but they look likes trees walking around.”

block.text: <<Aku melihat orang, sebab melihat mereka berjalan-jalan, tetapi tampaknya seperti pohon-pohon.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then again he laid his hands on his eyes. He looked intently, and was restored, and saw everyone clearly.

block.text: Yesus meletakkan lagi tangan-Nya pada mata orang itu, maka orang itu sungguh-sungguh melihat dan telah sembuh, sehingga ia dapat melihat segala sesuatu dengan jelas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent him away to his house, saying,

block.text: Sesudah itu Yesus menyuruh dia pulang ke rumahnya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t enter into the village, nor tell anyone in the village.”

block.text: <<Jangan masuk ke kampung!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went out, with his disciples, into the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples,

block.text: Kemudian Yesus beserta murid-murid-Nya berangkat ke kampung-kampung di sekitar Kaisarea Filipi. Di tengah jalan Ia bertanya kepada murid-murid-Nya, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who do men say that I am?”

block.text: <<Kata orang, siapakah Aku ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John the Baptizer, and others say Elijah, but others: one of the prophets.”

block.text: <<Ada yang mengatakan: Yohanes Pembaptis, ada juga yang mengatakan: Elia,>> <<ada pula yang mengatakan: seorang dari para nabi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Ia bertanya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But who do you say that I am?”

block.text: <<Tetapi apa katamu, siapakah Aku ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered,

block.text: Maka jawab Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are the Christ.”

block.text: <<Engkau adalah Mesias!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus commanded them, saying:

block.text: Lalu Yesus melarang mereka dengan keras supaya jangan memberitahukan

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one about me.”

block.text: kepada siapapun tentang Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus began to teach them, saying:

block.text: Kemudian mulailah Yesus mengajarkan kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.”

block.text: bahwa Anak Manusia harus menanggung banyak penderitaan dan ditolak oleh tua-tua, imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat, lalu dibunuh dan bangkit sesudah tiga hari.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke to them openly. Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

block.text: Hal ini dikatakan-Nya dengan terus terang. Tetapi Petrus menarik Yesus ke samping dan menegor Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, turning around, and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, and said,

block.text: Maka berpalinglah Yesus dan sambil memandang murid-murid-Nya Ia memarahi Petrus, kata-Nya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get behind me, Satan! For you have in mind not the things of God, but the things of men.”

block.text: <<Enyahlah Iblis, sebab engkau bukan memikirkan apa yang dipikirkan Allah, melainkan apa yang dipikirkan manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called the multitude to himself with his disciples, and said to them,

block.text: Lalu Yesus memanggil orang banyak dan murid-murid-Nya dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever wants to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

block.text: <<Setiap orang yang mau mengikut Aku, ia harus menyangkal dirinya, memikul salibnya dan mengikut Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it; and whoever will lose his life for my sake and the sake of the Good News will save it.

block.text: Karena siapa yang mau menyelamatkan nyawanya, ia akan kehilangan nyawanya; tetapi barangsiapa kehilangan nyawanya karena Aku dan karena Injil, ia akan menyelamatkannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what does it profit a man, to gain the whole world, and forfeit his life?

block.text: Apa gunanya seorang memperoleh seluruh dunia, tetapi ia kehilangan nyawanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what will a man give in exchange for his life?

block.text: Karena apakah yang dapat diberikannya sebagai ganti nyawanya?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man also will be ashamed of him, when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.”

block.text: Sebab barangsiapa malu karena Aku dan karena perkataan-Ku di tengah-tengah angkatan yang tidak setia dan berdosa ini, Anak Manusiapun akan malu karena orang itu apabila Ia datang kelak dalam kemuliaan Bapa-Nya, diiringi malaikat-malaikat kudus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 9
He said to them,

block.text: Kata-Nya lagi kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste death until they see the Kingdom of God come with power.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya di antara orang yang hadir di sini ada yang tidak akan mati sebelum mereka melihat bahwa Kerajaan Allah telah datang dengan kuasa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After six days Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John, and brought them up onto a high mountain privately by themselves, and he was changed into another form in front of them.

block.text: Enam hari kemudian Yesus membawa Petrus, Yakobus dan Yohanes dan bersama-sama dengan mereka Ia naik ke sebuah gunung yang tinggi. Di situ mereka sendirian saja. Lalu Yesus berubah rupa di depan mata mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: His clothing became glistening, exceedingly white, like snow, such as no launderer on earth can whiten them.

block.text: dan pakaian-Nya sangat putih berkilat-kilat. Tidak ada seorangpun di dunia ini yang dapat mengelantang pakaian seperti itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Elijah and Moses appeared to them, and they were talking with Jesus.
Peter said to Jesus,

block.text: Maka nampaklah kepada mereka Elia bersama dengan Musa, keduanya sedang berbicara dengan Yesus.
Kata Petrus kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let’s make three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

block.text: <<Rabi, betapa bahagianya kami berada di tempat ini. Baiklah kami dirikan tiga kemah, satu untuk Engkau, satu untuk Musa dan satu untuk Elia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he didn’t know what to say, for they were very afraid.

block.text: Ia berkata demikian, sebab tidak tahu apa yang harus dikatakannya, karena mereka sangat ketakutan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A cloud came, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud,

block.text: Maka datanglah awan menaungi mereka dan dari dalam awan itu terdengar suara:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him.”

block.text: <<Inilah Anak yang Kukasihi, dengarkanlah Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Suddenly looking around, they saw no one with them any more, except Jesus only.

block.text: Dan sekonyong-konyong waktu mereka memandang sekeliling mereka, mereka tidak melihat seorangpun lagi bersama mereka, kecuali Yesus seorang diri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were coming down from the mountain, he commanded them, saying:

block.text: Pada waktu mereka turun dari gunung itu, Yesus berpesan kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one what you have seen until after the Son of Man has risen from the dead.”

block.text: supaya mereka jangan menceriterakan kepada seorangpun apa yang telah mereka lihat itu, sebelum Anak Manusia bangkit dari antara orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They kept this saying to themselves, and asked each other:

block.text: Mereka memegang pesan tadi sambil mempersoalkan di antara mereka apa yang dimaksud

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does ‘Rising from the dead’ mean?”

block.text: dengan bangkit dari antara orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him, saying,

block.text: Lalu mereka bertanya kepada-Nya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

block.text: <<Mengapa ahli-ahli Taurat berkata, bahwa Elia harus datang dahulu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Elijah indeed comes first, and restores all things. How is it written about the Son of Man, that he should suffer many things and be despised?

block.text: <<Memang Elia akan datang dahulu dan memulihkan segala sesuatu. Hanya, bagaimanakah dengan yang ada tertulis mengenai Anak Manusia, bahwa Ia akan banyak menderita dan akan dihinakan?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they have also done to him whatever they wanted to, even as it is written about him.”

block.text: Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Memang Elia sudah datang dan orang memperlakukan dia menurut kehendak mereka, sesuai dengan yang ada tertulis tentang dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Coming to the disciples, he saw a great multitude around them, and scribes questioning them.

block.text: Ketika Yesus, Petrus, Yakobus dan Yohanes kembali pada murid-murid lain, mereka melihat orang banyak mengerumuni murid-murid itu, dan beberapa ahli Taurat sedang mempersoalkan sesuatu dengan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him greeted him.
He asked the scribes,

block.text: Pada waktu orang banyak itu melihat Yesus, tercenganglah mereka semua dan bergegas menyambut Dia.
Lalu Yesus bertanya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you asking them?”

block.text: <<Apa yang kamu persoalkan dengan mereka?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the multitude answered,

block.text: Kata seorang dari orang banyak itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, I brought to you my son, who has a mute spirit.

block.text: <<Guru, anakku ini kubawa kepada-Mu, karena ia kerasukan roh yang membisukan dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whenever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, and grinds his teeth, and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”

block.text: Dan setiap kali roh itu menyerang dia, roh itu membantingkannya ke tanah; lalu mulutnya berbusa, giginya bekertakan dan tubuhnya menjadi kejang. Aku sudah meminta kepada murid-murid-Mu, supaya mereka mengusir roh itu, tetapi mereka tidak dapat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered him,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unbelieving generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to me.”

block.text: <<Hai kamu angkatan yang tidak percaya, berapa lama lagi Aku harus tinggal di antara kamu? Berapa lama lagi Aku harus sabar terhadap kamu? Bawalah anak itu ke mari!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought him to him, and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground, wallowing and foaming at the mouth.

block.text: Lalu mereka membawanya kepada-Nya. Waktu roh itu melihat Yesus, anak itu segera digoncang-goncangnya, dan anak itu terpelanting ke tanah dan terguling-guling, sedang mulutnya berbusa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus asked the boy’s father,

block.text: Lalu Yesus bertanya kepada ayah anak itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How long has it been since this has come to him?”

block.text: <<Sudah berapa lama ia mengalami ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “From childhood.
Often it has cast him both into the fire and into the water, to destroy him. But if you can do anything, have compassion on us, and help us.”

block.text: <<Sejak masa kecilnya.
Dan seringkali roh itu menyeretnya ke dalam api ataupun ke dalam air untuk membinasakannya. Sebab itu jika Engkau dapat berbuat sesuatu, tolonglah kami dan kasihanilah kami.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.”

block.text: <<Katamu: jika Engkau dapat? Tidak ada yang mustahil bagi orang yang percaya!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the father of the child cried out with tears,

block.text: Segera ayah anak itu berteriak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, I believe. Help my unbelief!”

block.text: <<Aku percaya. Tolonglah aku yang tidak percaya ini!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus saw that a multitude came running together, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to him,

block.text: Ketika Yesus melihat orang banyak makin datang berkerumun, Ia menegor roh jahat itu dengan keras, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him, and never enter him again!”

block.text: <<Hai kau roh yang menyebabkan orang menjadi bisu dan tuli, Aku memerintahkan engkau, keluarlah dari pada anak ini dan jangan memasukinya lagi!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having cried out,
and convulsed greatly, it came out of him. The boy became like one dead; so much that most of them said,

block.text: Lalu keluarlah roh itu sambil berteriak
dan menggoncang-goncang anak itu dengan hebatnya. Anak itu kelihatannya seperti orang mati, sehingga banyak orang yang berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is dead.”

block.text: <<Ia sudah mati.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus took him by the hand, and raised him up; and he arose.

block.text: Tetapi Yesus memegang tangan anak itu dan membangunkannya, lalu ia bangkit sendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come into the house, his disciples asked him privately,

block.text: Ketika Yesus sudah di rumah, dan murid-murid-Nya sendirian dengan Dia, bertanyalah mereka:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why couldn’t we cast it out?”

block.text: <<Mengapa kami tidak dapat mengusir roh itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jawab-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This kind can come out by nothing, except by prayer and fasting.”

block.text: <<Jenis ini tidak dapat diusir kecuali dengan berdoa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went out from there, and passed through Galilee. He didn’t want anyone to know it.

block.text: Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya berangkat dari situ dan melewati Galilea, dan Yesus tidak mau hal itu diketahui orang;

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he was teaching his disciples, and said to them,

block.text: sebab Ia sedang mengajar murid-murid-Nya. Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man is being handed over to the hands of men, and they will kill him; and when he is killed, on the third day he will rise again.”

block.text: <<Anak Manusia akan diserahkan ke dalam tangan manusia, dan mereka akan membunuh Dia, dan tiga hari sesudah Ia dibunuh Ia akan bangkit.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they didn’t understand the saying, and were afraid to ask him.

block.text: Mereka tidak mengerti perkataan itu, namun segan menanyakannya kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to Capernaum, and when he was in the house he asked them,

block.text: Kemudian tibalah Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya di Kapernaum. Ketika Yesus sudah di rumah, Ia bertanya kepada murid-murid-Nya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What were you arguing among yourselves on the way?”

block.text: <<Apa yang kamu perbincangkan tadi di tengah jalan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they were silent, for they had disputed one with another on the way about who was the greatest.

block.text: Tetapi mereka diam, sebab di tengah jalan tadi mereka mempertengkarkan siapa yang terbesar di antara mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sat down, and called the twelve; and he said to them,

block.text: Lalu Yesus duduk dan memanggil kedua belas murid itu. Kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If any man wants to be first, he shall be last of all, and servant of all.”

block.text: <<Jika seseorang ingin menjadi yang terdahulu, hendaklah ia menjadi yang terakhir dari semuanya dan pelayan dari semuanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took a little child, and set him in their midst. Taking him in his arms, he said to them,

block.text: Maka Yesus mengambil seorang anak kecil dan menempatkannya di tengah-tengah mereka, kemudian Ia memeluk anak itu dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever receives one such little child in my name, receives me, and whoever receives me, doesn’t receive me, but him who sent me.”

block.text: <<Barangsiapa menyambut seorang anak seperti ini dalam nama-Ku, ia menyambut Aku. Dan barangsiapa menyambut Aku, bukan Aku yang disambutnya, tetapi Dia yang mengutus Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: John said to him,

block.text: Kata Yohanes kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we saw someone who doesn’t follow us casting out demons in your name; and we forbade him, because he doesn’t follow us.”

block.text: <<Guru, kami lihat seorang yang bukan pengikut kita mengusir setan demi nama-Mu, lalu kami cegah orang itu, karena ia bukan pengikut kita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said,

block.text: Tetapi kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t forbid him, for there is no one who will do a mighty work in my name, and be able quickly to speak evil of me.

block.text: <<Jangan kamu cegah dia! Sebab tidak seorangpun yang telah mengadakan mujizat demi nama-Ku, dapat seketika itu juga mengumpat Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever is not against us is on our side.

block.text: Barangsiapa tidak melawan kita, ia ada di pihak kita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever will give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because you are Christ’s, most certainly I tell you, he will in no way lose his reward.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya barangsiapa memberi kamu minum secangkir air oleh karena kamu adalah pengikut Kristus, ia tidak akan kehilangan upahnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever will cause one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him if he were thrown into the sea with a millstone hung around his neck.

block.text: <<Barangsiapa menyesatkan salah satu dari anak-anak kecil yang percaya ini, lebih baik baginya jika sebuah batu kilangan diikatkan pada lehernya lalu ia dibuang ke dalam laut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed, rather than having your two hands to go into Gehenna, into the unquenchable fire,

block.text: Dan jika tanganmu menyesatkan engkau, penggallah, karena lebih baik engkau masuk ke dalam hidup dengan tangan kudung dari pada dengan utuh kedua tanganmu dibuang ke dalam neraka, ke dalam api yang tak terpadamkan;

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’

block.text: (di tempat itu ulatnya tidak akan mati, dan apinya tidak akan padam.)

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life lame, rather than having your two feet to be cast into Gehenna, into the fire that will never be quenched--

block.text: Dan jika kakimu menyesatkan engkau, penggallah, karena lebih baik engkau masuk ke dalam hidup dengan timpang, dari pada dengan utuh kedua kakimu dicampakkan ke dalam neraka;

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’

block.text: (di tempat itu ulatnya tidak akan mati, dan apinya tidak akan padam.)

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your eye causes you to sin, cast it out. It is better for you to enter into the Kingdom of God with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire,

block.text: <<Dan jika matamu menyesatkan engkau, cungkillah, karena lebih baik engkau masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Allah dengan bermata satu dari pada dengan bermata dua dicampakkan ke dalam neraka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’

block.text: <di mana ulat-ulat bangkai tidak mati dan api tidak padam.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt.

block.text: Karena setiap orang akan digarami dengan api.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Salt is good, but if the salt has lost its saltiness, with what will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”

block.text: Garam memang baik, tetapi jika garam menjadi hambar, dengan apakah kamu mengasinkannya? Hendaklah kamu selalu mempunyai garam dalam dirimu dan selalu hidup berdamai yang seorang dengan yang lain.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 10
He arose from there and came into the borders of Judea and beyond the Jordan. Multitudes came together to him again. As he usually did, he was again teaching them.

block.text: Dari situ Yesus berangkat ke daerah Yudea dan ke daerah seberang sungai Yordan dan di situpun orang banyak datang mengerumuni Dia; dan seperti biasa Ia mengajar mereka pula.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pharisees came to him testing him, and asked him,

block.text: Maka datanglah orang-orang Farisi, dan untuk mencobai Yesus mereka bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”

block.text: <<Apakah seorang suami diperbolehkan menceraikan isterinya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: Tetapi jawab-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What did Moses command you?”

block.text: <<Apa perintah Musa kepada kamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Moses allowed a certificate of divorce to be written, and to divorce her.”

block.text: <<Musa memberi izin untuk menceraikannya dengan membuat surat cerai.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to them,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For your hardness of heart, he wrote you this commandment.

block.text: <<Justru karena ketegaran hatimulah maka Musa menuliskan perintah ini untuk kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But from the beginning of the creation, God made them male and female.

block.text: Sebab pada awal dunia, Allah <menjadikan mereka laki-laki dan perempuan,>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and will join to his wife,

block.text: <sebab itu laki-laki akan meninggalkan ayahnya dan ibunya dan bersatu dengan isterinya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and the two will become one flesh, so that they are no longer two, but one flesh.

block.text: sehingga keduanya itu menjadi satu daging.> Demikianlah mereka bukan lagi dua, melainkan satu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate.”

block.text: Karena itu, apa yang telah dipersatukan Allah, tidak boleh diceraikan manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the house, his disciples asked him again about the same matter.
He said to them,

block.text: Ketika mereka sudah di rumah, murid-murid itu bertanya pula kepada Yesus tentang hal itu.
Lalu kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery against her.

block.text: <<Barangsiapa menceraikan isterinya lalu kawin dengan perempuan lain, ia hidup dalam perzinahan terhadap isterinya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a woman herself divorces her husband, and marries another, she commits adultery.”

block.text: Dan jika si isteri menceraikan suaminya dan kawin dengan laki-laki lain, ia berbuat zinah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were bringing to him little children so that he would touch them, but the disciples rebuked those who were bringing them, saying:

block.text: Lalu orang membawa anak-anak kecil kepada Yesus, supaya Ia menjamah mereka; akan tetapi murid-murid-Nya memarahi

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t bother the teacher!”

block.text: orang-orang itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Jesus saw it, he was moved with indignation, and said to them,

block.text: Ketika Yesus melihat hal itu, Ia marah dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow the little children to come to me! Don’t forbid them, for the Kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

block.text: <<Biarkan anak-anak itu datang kepada-Ku, jangan menghalang-halangi mereka, sebab orang-orang yang seperti itulah yang empunya Kerajaan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, whoever will not receive the Kingdom of God like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya barangsiapa tidak menyambut Kerajaan Allah seperti seorang anak kecil, ia tidak akan masuk ke dalamnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took them in his arms, and blessed them, laying his hands on them.

block.text: Lalu Ia memeluk anak-anak itu dan sambil meletakkan tangan-Nya atas mereka Ia memberkati mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he was going out into the way, one ran to him, knelt before him, and asked him,

block.text: Pada waktu Yesus berangkat untuk meneruskan perjalanan-Nya, datanglah seorang berlari-lari mendapatkan Dia dan sambil bertelut di hadapan-Nya ia bertanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?”

block.text: <<Guru yang baik, apa yang harus kuperbuat untuk memperoleh hidup yang kekal?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you call me good? No one is good except one--God.

block.text: <<Mengapa kaukatakan Aku baik? Tak seorangpun yang baik selain dari pada Allah saja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder,’ ‘Do not commit adultery,’ ‘Do not steal,’ ‘Do not give false testimony,’ ‘Do not defraud,’ ‘Honor your father and mother.’”

block.text: Engkau tentu mengetahui segala perintah Allah: Jangan membunuh, jangan berzinah, jangan mencuri, jangan mengucapkan saksi dusta, jangan mengurangi hak orang, hormatilah ayahmu dan ibumu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Lalu kata orang itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, I have observed all these things from my youth.”

block.text: <<Guru, semuanya itu telah kuturuti sejak masa mudaku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus looking at him loved him, and said to him,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus memandang dia dan menaruh kasih kepadanya, lalu berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “One thing you lack. Go, sell whatever you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me, taking up the cross.”

block.text: <<Hanya satu lagi kekuranganmu: pergilah, juallah apa yang kaumiliki dan berikanlah itu kepada orang-orang miskin, maka engkau akan beroleh harta di sorga, kemudian datanglah ke mari dan ikutlah Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But his face fell at that saying, and he went away sorrowful, for he was one who had great possessions.

block.text: Mendengar perkataan itu ia menjadi kecewa, lalu pergi dengan sedih, sebab banyak hartanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus looked around, and said to his disciples,

block.text: Lalu Yesus memandang murid-murid-Nya di sekeliling-Nya dan berkata kepada mereka:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!”

block.text: <<Alangkah sukarnya orang yang beruang masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus answered again,

block.text: Murid-murid-Nya tercengang mendengar perkataan-Nya itu. Tetapi Yesus menyambung lagi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Children, how hard is it for those who trust in riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!

block.text: <<Anak-anak-Ku, alangkah sukarnya masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Lebih mudah seekor unta melewati lobang jarum dari pada seorang kaya masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were exceedingly astonished, saying to him,

block.text: Mereka makin gempar dan berkata seorang kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then who can be saved?”

block.text: <<Jika demikian, siapakah yang dapat diselamatkan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, looking at them, said,

block.text: Yesus memandang mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “With men it is impossible, but not with God, for all things are possible with God.”

block.text: <<Bagi manusia hal itu tidak mungkin, tetapi bukan demikian bagi Allah. Sebab segala sesuatu adalah mungkin bagi Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter began to tell him,

block.text: Berkatalah Petrus kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we have left all, and have followed you.”

block.text: <<Kami ini telah meninggalkan segala sesuatu dan mengikut Engkau!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or land, for my sake, and for the sake of the Good News,

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya setiap orang yang karena Aku dan karena Injil meninggalkan rumahnya, saudaranya laki-laki atau saudaranya perempuan, ibunya atau bapanya, anak-anaknya atau ladangnya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he will receive one hundred times more now in this time, houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and land, with persecutions; and in the age to come eternal life.

block.text: orang itu sekarang pada masa ini juga akan menerima kembali seratus kali lipat: rumah, saudara laki-laki, saudara perempuan, ibu, anak dan ladang, sekalipun disertai berbagai penganiayaan, dan pada zaman yang akan datang ia akan menerima hidup yang kekal.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But many who are first will be last; and the last first.”

block.text: Tetapi banyak orang yang terdahulu akan menjadi yang terakhir dan yang terakhir akan menjadi yang terdahulu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going in front of them, and they were amazed; and those who followed were afraid. He again took the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were going to happen to him, saying:

block.text: Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya sedang dalam perjalanan ke Yerusalem dan Yesus berjalan di depan. Murid-murid merasa cemas dan juga orang-orang yang mengikuti Dia dari belakang merasa takut. Sekali lagi Yesus memanggil kedua belas murid-Nya dan Ia mulai mengatakan kepada mereka apa yang akan terjadi atas diri-Nya,
kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death, and will deliver him to the Gentiles.

block.text: <<Sekarang kita pergi ke Yerusalem dan Anak Manusia akan diserahkan kepada imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat, dan mereka akan menjatuhi Dia hukuman mati. Dan mereka akan menyerahkan Dia kepada bangsa-bangsa yang tidak mengenal Allah,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will mock him, spit on him, scourge him, and kill him. On the third day he will rise again.”

block.text: dan Ia akan diolok-olokkan, diludahi, disesah dan dibunuh, dan sesudah tiga hari Ia akan bangkit.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came near to him, saying,

block.text: Lalu Yakobus dan Yohanes, anak-anak Zebedeus, mendekati Yesus dan berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we will ask.”

block.text: <<Guru, kami harap supaya Engkau kiranya mengabulkan suatu permintaan kami!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jawab-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want me to do for you?”

block.text: <<Apa yang kamu kehendaki Aku perbuat bagimu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Lalu kata mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Grant to us that we may sit, one at your right hand, and one at your left hand, in your glory.”

block.text: <<Perkenankanlah kami duduk dalam kemuliaan-Mu kelak, yang seorang lagi di sebelah kanan-Mu dan yang seorang di sebelah kiri-Mu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to them,

block.text: Tetapi kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You don’t know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”

block.text: <<Kamu tidak tahu apa yang kamu minta. Dapatkah kamu meminum cawan yang harus Kuminum dan dibaptis dengan baptisan yang harus Kuterima?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We are able.”

block.text: <<Kami dapat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You shall indeed drink the cup that I drink, and you shall be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with.

block.text: <<Memang, kamu akan meminum cawan yang harus Kuminum dan akan dibaptis dengan baptisan yang harus Kuterima.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But to sit at my right hand and at my left hand is not mine to give, but for whom it has been prepared.”

block.text: Tetapi hal duduk di sebelah kanan-Ku atau di sebelah kiri-Ku, Aku tidak berhak memberikannya. Itu akan diberikan kepada orang-orang bagi siapa itu telah disediakan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the ten heard it, they began to be indignant towards James and John.

block.text: Mendengar itu kesepuluh murid yang lain menjadi marah kepada Yakobus dan Yohanes.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus summoned them, and said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus memanggil mereka lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You know that they who are recognized as rulers over the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.

block.text: <<Kamu tahu, bahwa mereka yang disebut pemerintah bangsa-bangsa memerintah rakyatnya dengan tangan besi, dan pembesar-pembesarnya menjalankan kuasanya dengan keras atas mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But it shall not be so among you, but whoever wants to become great among you shall be your servant.

block.text: Tidaklah demikian di antara kamu. Barangsiapa ingin menjadi besar di antara kamu, hendaklah ia menjadi pelayanmu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever of you wants to become first among you, shall be bondservant of all.

block.text: dan barangsiapa ingin menjadi yang terkemuka di antara kamu, hendaklah ia menjadi hamba untuk semuanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man also came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

block.text: Karena Anak Manusia juga datang bukan untuk dilayani, melainkan untuk melayani dan untuk memberikan nyawa-Nya menjadi tebusan bagi banyak orang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to Jericho. As he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.

block.text: Lalu tibalah Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya di Yerikho. Dan ketika Yesus keluar dari Yerikho, bersama-sama dengan murid-murid-Nya dan orang banyak yang berbondong-bondong, ada seorang pengemis yang buta, bernama Bartimeus, anak Timeus, duduk di pinggir jalan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, and say,

block.text: Ketika didengarnya, bahwa itu adalah Yesus orang Nazaret, mulailah ia berseru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus, son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: <<Yesus, Anak Daud, kasihanilah aku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many rebuked him, saying:

block.text: Banyak menegur Dia, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be quiet!”

block.text: "Diam!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he cried out even more,

block.text: Tapi dia berteriak bahkan lebih:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: <<Anak Daud, kasihanilah aku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus stood still, and said,

block.text: Lalu Yesus berhenti dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Call him.”

block.text: <<Panggillah dia!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They called the blind man, saying to him,

block.text: Mereka memanggil orang buta itu dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cheer up! Get up. He is calling you!”

block.text: <<Kuatkan hatimu, berdirilah, Ia memanggil engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He, casting away his cloak, sprang up, and came to Jesus.
Jesus asked him,

block.text: Lalu ia menanggalkan jubahnya, ia segera berdiri dan pergi mendapatkan Yesus.
Tanya Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want me to do for you?”

block.text: <<Apa yang kaukehendaki supaya Aku perbuat bagimu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The blind man said to him,

block.text: Jawab orang buta itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, that I may see again.”

block.text: <<Rabuni, supaya aku dapat melihat!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way. Your faith has made you well.”

block.text: <<Pergilah, imanmu telah menyelamatkan engkau!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.

block.text: Pada saat itu juga melihatlah ia, lalu ia mengikuti Yesus dalam perjalanan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 11
When they drew near to Jerusalem, to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,
and said to them,

block.text: Ketika Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya telah dekat Yerusalem, dekat Betfage dan Betania yang terletak di Bukit Zaitun, Yesus menyuruh dua orang murid-Nya
dengan pesan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way into the village that is opposite you. Immediately as you enter into it, you will find a young donkey tied, on which no one has sat. Untie him, and bring him.

block.text: <<Pergilah ke kampung yang di depanmu itu. Pada waktu kamu masuk di situ, kamu akan segera menemukan seekor keledai muda tertambat, yang belum pernah ditunggangi orang. Lepaskan keledai itu dan bawalah ke mari.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs him;’ and immediately he will send him back here.”

block.text: Dan jika ada orang mengatakan kepadamu: <Mengapa kamu lakukan itu,> jawablah: <Tuhan memerlukannya. Ia akan segera mengembalikannya ke sini.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went away, and found a young donkey tied at the door outside in the open street, and they untied him.

block.text: Merekapun pergi, dan menemukan seekor keledai muda tertambat di depan pintu di luar, di pinggir jalan, lalu melepaskannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of those who stood there asked them,

block.text: Dan beberapa orang yang ada di situ berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you doing, untying the young donkey?”

block.text: <<Apa maksudnya kamu melepaskan keledai itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to them:

block.text: Lalu mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord needs him.”

block.text: menjawab seperti yang sudah dikatakan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The people told them:

block.text: Maka orang-orang itu

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You may go.”

block.text: membiarkan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought the young donkey to Jesus, and threw their garments on it, and Jesus sat on it.

block.text: Lalu mereka membawa keledai itu kepada Yesus, dan mengalasinya dengan pakaian mereka, kemudian Yesus naik ke atasnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many spread their garments on the way, and others were cutting down branches from the trees, and spreading them on the road.

block.text: Banyak orang yang menghamparkan pakaiannya di jalan, ada pula yang menyebarkan ranting-ranting hijau yang mereka ambil dari ladang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who went in front, and those who followed, cried out,

block.text: Orang-orang yang berjalan di depan dan mereka yang mengikuti dari belakang berseru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!

block.text: <<Hosana! Diberkatilah Dia yang datang dalam nama Tuhan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is coming in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”

block.text: diberkatilah Kerajaan yang datang, Kerajaan bapak kita Daud, hosana di tempat yang maha tinggi!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus entered into the temple in Jerusalem. When he had looked around at everything, it being now evening, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.

block.text: Sesampainya di Yerusalem Ia masuk ke Bait Allah. Di sana Ia meninjau semuanya, tetapi sebab hari sudah hampir malam Ia keluar ke Betania bersama dengan kedua belas murid-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The next day, when they had come out from Bethany, he was hungry.

block.text: Keesokan harinya sesudah Yesus dan kedua belas murid-Nya meninggalkan Betania, Yesus merasa lapar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came to see if perhaps he might find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
Jesus told it,

block.text: Dan dari jauh Ia melihat pohon ara yang sudah berdaun. Ia mendekatinya untuk melihat kalau-kalau Ia mendapat apa-apa pada pohon itu. Tetapi waktu Ia tiba di situ, Ia tidak mendapat apa-apa selain daun-daun saja, sebab memang bukan musim buah ara.
Maka kata-Nya kepada pohon itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!”

block.text: <<Jangan lagi seorangpun makan buahmu selama-lamanya!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and his disciples heard it.

block.text: Dan murid-murid-Nyapun mendengarnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to Jerusalem, and Jesus entered into the temple, and began to throw out those who sold and those who bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the money changers, and the seats of those who sold the doves.

block.text: Mereka datang ke Yerusalem dan Yesus masuk ke Bait Allah dan mulailah Ia mengusir mereka yang menjual dan mereka yang membeli di bait suci. Dia menggulingkan meja-meja penukar uang dan kursi-kursi mereka yang menjual merpati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He would not allow anyone to carry a container through the temple.

block.text: Dia tidak akan memperbolehkan orang membawa wadah melalui kuil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He taught, saying to them,

block.text: Lalu Ia mengajar mereka, kata-Nya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn’t it written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all the nations?’ But you have made it a den of robbers!”

block.text: <<Bukankah ada tertulis: <Rumah-Ku akan disebut rumah doa bagi segala bangsa?> Tetapi kamu ini telah menjadikannya <sarang penyamun!> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and the scribes heard it, and sought how they might destroy him. For they feared him, because all the multitude was astonished at his teaching.

block.text: Imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat mendengar tentang peristiwa itu, dan mereka berusaha untuk membinasakan Dia, sebab mereka takut kepada-Nya, melihat seluruh orang banyak takjub akan pengajaran-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening came, he went out of the city.

block.text: Menjelang malam mereka keluar lagi dari kota.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away from the roots.

block.text: Pagi-pagi ketika Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya lewat, mereka melihat pohon ara tadi sudah kering sampai ke akar-akarnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter, remembering, said to him,

block.text: Maka teringatlah Petrus akan apa yang telah terjadi, lalu ia berkata kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has withered away.”

block.text: <<Rabi, lihatlah, pohon ara yang Kaukutuk itu sudah kering.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Yesus menjawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have faith in God.

For most certainly I tell you, whoever may tell this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ and doesn’t doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says is happening; he shall have whatever he says.

block.text: <<Percayalah kepada Allah!

Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya barangsiapa berkata kepada gunung ini: Beranjaklah dan tercampaklah ke dalam laut! asal tidak bimbang hatinya, tetapi percaya, bahwa apa yang dikatakannya itu akan terjadi, maka hal itu akan terjadi baginya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I tell you, all things whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received them, and you shall have them.

block.text: Karena itu Aku berkata kepadamu: apa saja yang kamu minta dan doakan, percayalah bahwa kamu telah menerimanya, maka hal itu akan diberikan kepadamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive them so that your Father who is in heaven may also forgive you your transgressions.

block.text: Dan jika kamu berdiri untuk berdoa, ampunilah dahulu sekiranya ada barang sesuatu dalam hatimu terhadap seseorang, supaya juga Bapamu yang di sorga mengampuni kesalahan-kesalahanmu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your transgressions.”

block.text: (Tetapi jika kamu tidak mengampuni, maka Bapamu yang di sorga juga tidak akan mengampuni kesalahan-kesalahanmu.)

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders came to him,
and they began saying to him,

block.text: Lalu Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya tiba pula di Yerusalem. Ketika Yesus berjalan di halaman Bait Allah, datanglah kepada-Nya imam-imam kepala, ahli-ahli Taurat dan tua-tua,
dan bertanya kepada-Nya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “By what authority do you do these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?”

block.text: <<Dengan kuasa manakah Engkau melakukan hal-hal itu? Dan siapakah yang memberikan kuasa itu kepada-Mu, sehingga Engkau melakukan hal-hal itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

block.text: <<Aku akan mengajukan satu pertanyaan kepadamu. Berikanlah Aku jawabnya, maka Aku akan mengatakan kepadamu dengan kuasa manakah Aku melakukan hal-hal itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The baptism of John--was it from heaven, or from men? Answer me.”

block.text: Baptisan Yohanes itu, dari sorga atau dari manusia? Berikanlah Aku jawabnya!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying,

block.text: Mereka memperbincangkannya di antara mereka, dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If we should say, ‘From heaven’; he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

block.text: <<Jikalau kita katakan: Dari sorga, Ia akan berkata: <Kalau begitu, mengapakah kamu tidak percaya kepadanya?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: If we should say, ‘From men’”

block.text: Tetapi, masakan kita katakan: <Dari manusia!> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: --they feared the people because they believed that John really was a prophet.
They answered Jesus,

block.text: Sebab mereka takut kepada orang banyak, karena semua orang menganggap bahwa Yohanes betul-betul seorang nabi.
Lalu mereka menjawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We don’t know.”

block.text: <<Kami tidak tahu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

block.text: <<Jika demikian, Aku juga tidak mengatakan kepadamu dengan kuasa manakah Aku melakukan hal-hal itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 12
He began to speak to them in parables.

block.text: Lalu Yesus mulai berbicara kepada mereka dalam perumpamaan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A man planted a vineyard, put a hedge around it, dug a pit for the winepress, built a tower, rented it out to a farmer, and went into another country.

block.text: <<Adalah seorang membuka kebun anggur dan menanam pagar sekelilingnya. Ia menggali lobang tempat memeras anggur dan mendirikan menara jaga. Kemudian ia menyewakan kebun itu kepada penggarap-penggarap lalu berangkat ke negeri lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was time, he sent a servant to the farmer to get from the farmer his share of the fruit of the vineyard.

block.text: Dan ketika sudah tiba musimnya, ia menyuruh seorang hamba kepada penggarap-penggarap itu untuk menerima sebagian dari hasil kebun itu dari mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took him, beat him, and sent him away empty.

block.text: Tetapi mereka menangkap hamba itu dan memukulnya, lalu menyuruhnya pergi dengan tangan hampa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, he sent another servant to them; and they threw stones at him, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated.

block.text: Kemudian ia menyuruh pula seorang hamba lain kepada mereka. Orang ini mereka pukul sampai luka kepalanya dan sangat mereka permalukan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he sent another; and they killed him; and many others, beating some, and killing some.

block.text: Lalu ia menyuruh seorang hamba lain lagi, dan orang ini mereka bunuh. Dan banyak lagi yang lain, ada yang mereka pukul dan ada yang mereka bunuh.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore still having one, his beloved son, he sent him last to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

block.text: <<Sekarang tinggal hanya satu orang anaknya yang kekasih. Akhirnya ia menyuruh dia kepada mereka, katanya: <Anakku akan mereka segani.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But those farmers said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’

block.text: Tetapi penggarap-penggarap itu berkata seorang kepada yang lain: <Ia adalah ahli waris, mari kita bunuh dia, maka warisan ini menjadi milik kita.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took him, killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.

block.text: Mereka menangkapnya dan membunuhnya, lalu melemparkannya ke luar kebun anggur itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.

block.text: Sekarang apa yang akan dilakukan oleh tuan kebun anggur itu? Ia akan datang dan membinasakan penggarap-penggarap itu, lalu mempercayakan kebun anggur itu kepada orang-orang lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Haven’t you even read this Scripture: ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the head of the corner.

block.text: Tidak pernahkah kamu membaca nas ini: <Batu yang dibuang oleh tukang-tukang bangunan telah menjadi batu penjuru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: This was from the Lord, it is marvelous in our eyes’?”

block.text: hal itu terjadi dari pihak Tuhan, suatu perbuatan ajaib di mata kita.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They tried to seize him, but they feared the multitude; for they perceived that he spoke the parable against them. They left him, and went away.

block.text: Lalu mereka berusaha untuk menangkap Yesus, karena mereka tahu, bahwa merekalah yang dimaksudkan-Nya dengan perumpamaan itu. Tetapi mereka takut kepada orang banyak, jadi mereka pergi dan membiarkan Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They sent some of the Pharisees and of the Herodians to him, that they might trap him with words.

block.text: Kemudian disuruh beberapa orang Farisi dan Herodian kepada Yesus untuk menjerat Dia dengan suatu pertanyaan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come, they asked him,

block.text: Orang-orang itu datang dan berkata kepada-Nya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we know that you are honest, and don’t defer to anyone; for you aren’t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?
Shall we give, or shall we not give?”

block.text: <<Guru, kami tahu, Engkau adalah seorang yang jujur, dan Engkau tidak takut kepada siapapun juga, sebab Engkau tidak mencari muka, melainkan dengan jujur mengajar jalan Allah dengan segala kejujuran. Apakah diperbolehkan membayar pajak kepada Kaisar atau tidak? Haruskah kami bayar atau tidak?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus mengetahui kemunafikan mereka, lalu berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you test me? Bring me a denarius, that I may see it.”

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu mencobai Aku? Bawalah ke mari suatu dinar supaya Kulihat!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought it. He said to them,

block.text: Lalu mereka bawa. Maka Ia bertanya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whose is this image and inscription?”

block.text: <<Gambar dan tulisan siapakah ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Caesar’s.”

block.text: <<Gambar dan tulisan Kaisar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”

block.text: <<Berikanlah kepada Kaisar apa yang wajib kamu berikan kepada Kaisar dan kepada Allah apa yang wajib kamu berikan kepada Allah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They marveled greatly at him.

block.text: Mereka sangat heran mendengar Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There came to him Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection. They asked him, saying,

block.text: Datanglah kepada Yesus beberapa orang Saduki, yang berpendapat, bahwa tidak ada kebangkitan. Mereka bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us, ‘If a man’s brother dies, and leaves a wife behind him, and leaves no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up offspring for his brother.’

block.text: <<Guru, Musa menuliskan perintah ini untuk kita: Jika seorang, yang mempunyai saudara laki-laki, mati dengan meninggalkan seorang isteri tetapi tidak meninggalkan anak, saudaranya harus kawin dengan isterinya itu dan membangkitkan keturunan bagi saudaranya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and dying left no offspring.

block.text: Adalah tujuh orang bersaudara. Yang pertama kawin dengan seorang perempuan dan mati dengan tidak meninggalkan keturunan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The second took her, and died, leaving no children behind him. The third likewise;

block.text: Lalu yang kedua juga mengawini dia dan mati dengan tidak meninggalkan keturunan. Demikian juga dengan yang ketiga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and the seven took her and left no children. Last of all the woman also died.

block.text: Dan begitulah seterusnya, ketujuhnya tidak meninggalkan keturunan. Dan akhirnya, sesudah mereka semua, perempuan itupun mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be of them? For the seven had her as a wife.”

block.text: Pada hari kebangkitan, bilamana mereka bangkit, siapakah yang menjadi suami perempuan itu? Sebab ketujuhnya telah beristerikan dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn’t this because you are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God?

block.text: <<Kamu sesat, justru karena kamu tidak mengerti Kitab Suci maupun kuasa Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when they will rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.

block.text: Sebab apabila orang bangkit dari antara orang mati, orang tidak kawin dan tidak dikawinkan melainkan hidup seperti malaikat di sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But about the dead, that they are raised; haven’t you read in the book of Moses, about the Bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?

block.text: Dan juga tentang bangkitnya orang-orang mati, tidakkah kamu baca dalam kitab Musa, dalam ceritera tentang semak duri, bagaimana bunyi firman Allah kepadanya: <Akulah Allah Abraham, Allah Ishak dan Allah Yakub?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are therefore badly mistaken.”

block.text: Ia bukanlah Allah orang mati, melainkan Allah orang hidup. Kamu benar-benar sesat!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the scribes came, and heard them questioning together. Knowing that he had answered them well, asked him,

block.text: Lalu seorang ahli Taurat, yang mendengar Yesus dan orang-orang Saduki bersoal jawab dan tahu, bahwa Yesus memberi jawab yang tepat kepada orang-orang itu, datang kepada-Nya dan bertanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which commandment is the greatest of all?”

block.text: <<Hukum manakah yang paling utama?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The greatest is, ‘Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one:

block.text: <<Hukum yang terutama ialah: <Dengarlah, hai orang Israel, Tuhan Allah kita, Tuhan itu esa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength.’ This is the first commandment.

block.text: Kasihilah Tuhan, Allahmu, dengan segenap hatimu dan dengan segenap jiwamu dan dengan segenap akal budimu dan dengan segenap kekuatanmu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The second is like this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”

block.text: Dan hukum yang kedua ialah: <Kasihilah sesamamu manusia seperti dirimu sendiri.> Tidak ada hukum lain yang lebih utama dari pada kedua hukum ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The scribe said to him,

block.text: Lalu kata ahli Taurat itu kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly, teacher, you have said well that he is one, and there is none other but he.

block.text: <<Tepat sekali, Guru, benar kata-Mu itu, bahwa Dia esa, dan bahwa tidak ada yang lain kecuali Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”

block.text: Memang mengasihi Dia dengan segenap hati dan dengan segenap pengertian dan dengan segenap kekuatan, dan juga mengasihi sesama manusia seperti diri sendiri adalah jauh lebih utama dari pada semua korban bakaran dan korban sembelihan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him,

block.text: Yesus melihat, bagaimana bijaksananya jawab orang itu, dan Ia berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are not far from the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: <<Engkau tidak jauh dari Kerajaan Allah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one dared ask him any question after that.

block.text: Dan seorangpun tidak berani lagi menanyakan sesuatu kepada Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus responded, as he taught in the temple,

block.text: Pada suatu kali ketika Yesus mengajar di Bait Allah, Ia berkata:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How is it that the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?

block.text: <<Bagaimana ahli-ahli Taurat dapat mengatakan, bahwa Mesias adalah anak Daud?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For David himself said in the Holy Spirit, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.” ’

block.text: Daud sendiri oleh pimpinan Roh Kudus berkata: <Tuhan telah berfirman kepada Tuanku: <<duduklah di sebelah kanan-Ku, sampai musuh-musuh-Mu Kutaruh di bawah kaki-Mu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore David himself calls him Lord, so how can he be his son?”

block.text: Daud sendiri menyebut Dia <Tuannya,> bagaimana mungkin Ia anaknya pula?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The common people heard him gladly.

block.text: Orang banyak yang besar jumlahnya mendengarkan Dia dengan penuh minat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In his teaching he said to them,

block.text: Dalam pengajaran-Nya Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Beware of the scribes. They like to walk around in long robes, and to get greetings in the marketplaces.

block.text: <<Waspadalah terhadap ahli-ahli Taurat. Mereka suka berjalan dalam jubah panjang, dan untuk mendapatkan salam di pasar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They choose the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts.

block.text: Mereka memilih tempat duduk terbaik di rumah-rumah ibadat, dan tempat terbaik pada pesta-pesta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. They will receive the greater damnation.”

block.text: Mereka melahap rumah janda, dan untuk berpura-pura, mereka membuat doa-doa panjang. Mereka ini pasti akan menerima hukuman yang lebih berat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus sat down opposite the treasury, and saw how the multitude cast money into the treasury. Many who were rich cast in much.

block.text: Pada suatu kali Yesus duduk menghadapi peti persembahan dan memperhatikan bagaimana orang banyak memasukkan uang ke dalam peti itu. Banyak orang kaya memberi jumlah yang besar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A poor widow came, and she cast in two small copper coins, which equal a penny.

block.text: Lalu datanglah seorang janda yang miskin dan ia memasukkan dua peser, yaitu satu duit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called his disciples to himself, and said to them,

block.text: Maka dipanggil-Nya murid-murid-Nya dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, this poor widow gave more than all those who are giving into the treasury.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya janda miskin ini memberi lebih banyak dari pada semua orang yang memasukkan uang ke dalam peti persembahan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all gave out of their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, gave all that she had to live on.”

block.text: Sebab mereka semua memberi dari kelimpahannya, tetapi janda ini memberi dari kekurangannya, semua yang ada padanya, yaitu seluruh nafkahnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 13
As he went out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him,

block.text: Ketika Yesus keluar dari Bait Allah, seorang murid-Nya berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, see what kind of stones and what kind of buildings!”

block.text: <<Guru, lihatlah betapa kokohnya batu-batu itu dan betapa megahnya gedung-gedung itu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Lalu Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left here one stone on another, which will not be thrown down.”

block.text: <<Kaulihat gedung-gedung yang hebat ini? Tidak satu batupun akan dibiarkan terletak di atas batu yang lain, semuanya akan diruntuhkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,

block.text: Ketika Yesus duduk di atas Bukit Zaitun, berhadapan dengan Bait Allah, Petrus, Yakobus, Yohanes dan Andreas bertanya sendirian kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are all about to be fulfilled?”

block.text: <<Katakanlah kepada kami, bilamanakah itu akan terjadi, dan apakah tandanya, kalau semuanya itu akan sampai kepada kesudahannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, answering, began to tell them,

block.text: Maka mulailah Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be careful that no one leads you astray.

block.text: <<Waspadalah supaya jangan ada orang yang menyesatkan kamu!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am Christ!’ and will lead many astray.”

block.text: Akan datang banyak orang dengan memakai nama-Ku dan berkata: <Akulah dia,> dan mereka akan menyesatkan banyak orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don’t be troubled. For those must happen, but the end is not yet.

block.text: Dan apabila kamu mendengar deru perang atau kabar-kabar tentang perang, janganlah kamu gelisah. Semuanya itu harus terjadi, tetapi itu belum kesudahannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines and troubles. These things are the beginning of birth pains.

block.text: Sebab bangsa akan bangkit melawan bangsa dan kerajaan melawan kerajaan. Akan terjadi gempa bumi di berbagai tempat, dan akan ada kelaparan. Semua itu barulah permulaan penderitaan menjelang zaman baru.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But watch yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils. You will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them.

block.text: <<Tetapi kamu ini, hati-hatilah! Kamu akan diserahkan kepada majelis agama dan kamu akan dipukul di rumah ibadat dan kamu akan dihadapkan ke muka penguasa-penguasa dan raja-raja karena Aku, sebagai kesaksian bagi mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Good News must first be preached to all the nations.

block.text: Tetapi Injil harus diberitakan dahulu kepada semua bangsa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they lead you away and deliver you up, don’t be anxious beforehand, or premeditate what you will say, but say whatever will be given you in that hour. For it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.”

block.text: Dan jika kamu digiring dan diserahkan, janganlah kamu kuatir akan apa yang harus kamu katakan, tetapi katakanlah apa yang dikaruniakan kepadamu pada saat itu juga, sebab bukan kamu yang berkata-kata, melainkan Roh Kudus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.

block.text: <<Seorang saudara akan menyerahkan saudaranya untuk dibunuh, demikian juga seorang ayah terhadap anaknya. Dan anak-anak akan memberontak terhadap orang tuanya dan akan membunuh mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake, but he who endures to the end, the same will be saved.

block.text: Kamu akan dibenci semua orang oleh karena nama-Ku. Tetapi orang yang bertahan sampai pada kesudahannya ia akan selamat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

block.text: <<Apabila kamu melihat Pembinasa keji berdiri di tempat yang tidak sepatutnya—para pembaca hendaklah memperhatikannya—maka orang-orang yang di Yudea haruslah melarikan diri ke pegunungan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let him who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house.

block.text: Orang yang sedang di peranginan di atas rumah janganlah ia turun dan masuk untuk mengambil sesuatu dari rumahnya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let him who is in the field not return back to take his cloak.

block.text: Orang yang sedang di ladang janganlah ia kembali untuk mengambil pakaiannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But woe to those who are with child and to those who nurse babies in those days!

block.text: Celakalah ibu-ibu yang sedang hamil atau yang menyusukan bayi pada masa itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pray that your flight won’t be in the winter.

block.text: Berdoalah, supaya semuanya itu jangan terjadi pada musim dingin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in those days there will be oppression, such as there has not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will be.

block.text: Sebab pada masa itu akan terjadi siksaan seperti yang belum pernah terjadi sejak awal dunia, yang diciptakan Allah, sampai sekarang dan yang tidak akan terjadi lagi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but for the sake of the chosen ones, whom he picked out, he shortened the days.

block.text: <<Dan sekiranya Tuhan tidak mempersingkat waktunya, maka dari segala yang hidup tidak akan ada yang selamat; akan tetapi oleh karena orang-orang pilihan yang telah dipilih-Nya, Tuhan mempersingkat waktunya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ don’t believe it.

block.text: Pada waktu itu jika orang berkata kepada kamu: <Lihat, Mesias ada di sini,> atau: <Lihat, Mesias ada di sana,> jangan kamu percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there will arise false christs and false prophets, and will show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.

block.text: Sebab Mesias-mesias palsu dan nabi-nabi palsu akan muncul dan mereka akan mengadakan tanda-tanda dan mujizat-mujizat dengan maksud, sekiranya mungkin, menyesatkan orang-orang pilihan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you watch. Behold, I have told you all things beforehand.
