block.text: Hati-hatilah kamu! Aku sudah terlebih dahulu mengatakan semuanya ini kepada kamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But in those days, after that oppression, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light,

block.text: <<Tetapi pada masa itu, sesudah siksaan itu, <matahari akan menjadi gelap dan bulan tidak bercahaya

ReferenceBlocks.text: the stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.

block.text: dan bintang-bintang akan berjatuhan dari langit, dan kuasa-kuasa langit akan goncang.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

block.text: Pada waktu itu orang akan melihat Anak Manusia datang dalam awan-awan dengan segala kekuasaan dan kemuliaan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he will send out his angels, and will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the sky.”

block.text: Dan pada waktu itupun Ia akan menyuruh keluar malaikat-malaikat-Nya dan akan mengumpulkan orang-orang pilihan-Nya dari keempat penjuru bumi, dari ujung bumi sampai ke ujung langit.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now from the fig tree, learn this parable. When the branch has now become tender, and puts forth its leaves, you know that the summer is near.

block.text: <<Tariklah pelajaran dari perumpamaan tentang pohon ara. Apabila ranting-rantingnya melembut dan mulai bertunas, kamu tahu, bahwa musim panas sudah dekat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so you also, when you see these things coming to pass, know that it is near, at the doors.

block.text: Demikian juga, jika kamu lihat hal-hal itu terjadi, ketahuilah bahwa waktunya sudah dekat, sudah di ambang pintu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya angkatan ini tidak akan berlalu, sebelum semuanya itu terjadi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.

block.text: Langit dan bumi akan berlalu, tetapi perkataan-Ku tidak akan berlalu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But of that day or that hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

block.text: Tetapi tentang hari atau saat itu tidak seorangpun yang tahu, malaikat-malaikat di sorga tidak, dan Anakpun tidak, hanya Bapa saja.>>"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Watch, keep alert, and pray; for you don’t know when the time is.”

block.text: Hati-hatilah dan berjaga-jagalah! Sebab kamu tidak tahu bilamanakah waktunya tiba.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is like a man, traveling to another country, having left his house, and given authority to his servants, and to each one his work, and also commanded the doorkeeper to keep watch.

block.text: Dan halnya sama seperti seorang yang bepergian, yang meninggalkan rumahnya dan menyerahkan tanggung jawab kepada hamba-hambanya, masing-masing dengan tugasnya, dan memerintahkan penunggu pintu supaya berjaga-jaga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Watch therefore, for you don’t know when the lord of the house is coming, whether at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning;

block.text: Karena itu berjaga-jagalah, sebab kamu tidak tahu bilamanakah tuan rumah itu pulang, menjelang malam, atau tengah malam, atau larut malam, atau pagi-pagi buta,

ReferenceBlocks.text: lest coming suddenly he might find you sleeping.

block.text: supaya kalau ia tiba-tiba datang jangan kamu didapatinya sedang tidur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What I tell you, I tell all: Watch.”

block.text: Apa yang Kukatakan kepada kamu, Kukatakan kepada semua orang: berjaga-jagalah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 14
It was now two days before the feast of the Passover and the unleavened bread, and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might seize him by deception, and kill him.
For they said,

block.text: Hari raya Paskah dan hari raya Roti Tidak Beragi akan mulai dua hari lagi. Imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat mencari jalan untuk menangkap dan membunuh Yesus dengan tipu muslihat,
sebab mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not during the feast, because there might be a riot of the people.”

block.text: <<Jangan pada waktu perayaan, supaya jangan timbul keributan di antara rakyat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was at Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster jar of ointment of pure nard--very costly. She broke the jar, and poured it over his head.

block.text: Ketika Yesus berada di Betania, di rumah Simon si kusta, dan sedang duduk makan, datanglah seorang perempuan membawa suatu buli-buli pualam berisi minyak narwastu murni yang mahal harganya. Setelah dipecahkannya leher buli-buli itu, dicurahkannya minyak itu ke atas kepala Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there were some who were indignant among themselves, saying,

block.text: Ada orang yang menjadi gusar dan berkata seorang kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why has this ointment been wasted?

block.text: <<Untuk apa pemborosan minyak narwastu ini?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii, and given to the poor.”

block.text: Sebab minyak ini dapat dijual tiga ratus dinar lebih dan uangnya dapat diberikan kepada orang-orang miskin.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They grumbled against her.
But Jesus said,

block.text: Lalu mereka memarahi perempuan itu.
Tetapi Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for me.

block.text: <<Biarkanlah dia. Mengapa kamu menyusahkan dia? Ia telah melakukan suatu perbuatan yang baik pada-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want to, you can do them good; but you will not always have me.

block.text: Karena orang-orang miskin selalu ada padamu, dan kamu dapat menolong mereka, bilamana kamu menghendakinya, tetapi Aku tidak akan selalu bersama-sama kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She has done what she could. She has anointed my body beforehand for the burying.

block.text: Ia telah melakukan apa yang dapat dilakukannya. Tubuh-Ku telah diminyakinya sebagai persiapan untuk penguburan-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News may be preached throughout the whole world, that which this woman has done will also be spoken of for a memorial of her.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya di mana saja Injil diberitakan di seluruh dunia, apa yang dilakukannya ini akan disebut juga untuk mengingat dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went to the chief priests and said:

block.text: Lalu pergilah Yudas Iskariot, salah seorang dari kedua belas murid itu, kepada imam-imam kepala dengan maksud untuk

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will hand him over to you.”

block.text: menyerahkan Yesus kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard this they rejoiced and said:

block.text: Mereka sangat gembira waktu mendengarnya dan mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We will pay you for this!”

block.text: berjanji akan memberikan uang kepadanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He began looking for a convenient time to betray Jesus.

block.text: Kemudian ia mencari kesempatan yang baik untuk menyerahkan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, his disciples asked him,

block.text: Pada hari pertama dari hari raya Roti Tidak Beragi, pada waktu orang menyembelih domba Paskah, murid-murid Yesus berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where do you want us to go and prepare that you may eat the Passover?”

block.text: <<Ke tempat mana Engkau kehendaki kami pergi untuk mempersiapkan perjamuan Paskah bagi-Mu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent two of his disciples, and said to them,

block.text: Lalu Ia menyuruh dua orang murid-Nya dengan pesan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go into the city, and there you will meet a man carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him.

block.text: <<Pergilah ke kota; di sana kamu akan bertemu dengan seorang yang membawa kendi berisi air. Ikutilah dia

ReferenceBlocks.text: Wherever he enters in, tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’

block.text: dan katakanlah kepada pemilik rumah yang dimasukinya: Pesan Guru: <di manakah ruangan yang disediakan bagi-Ku untuk makan Paskah bersama-sama dengan murid-murid-Ku?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will himself show you a large upper room furnished and ready. Get ready for us there.”

block.text: Lalu orang itu akan menunjukkan kamu sebuah ruangan atas yang besar, yang sudah lengkap dan tersedia. Di situlah kamu harus mempersiapkan perjamuan Paskah untuk kita!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found things as he had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.

block.text: Maka berangkatlah kedua murid itu dan setibanya di kota, didapati mereka semua seperti yang dikatakan Yesus kepada mereka. Lalu mereka mempersiapkan Paskah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was evening he came with the twelve.
As they sat and were eating, Jesus said,

block.text: Setelah hari malam, datanglah Yesus bersama-sama dengan kedua belas murid itu.
Ketika mereka duduk di situ dan sedang makan, Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, one of you will betray me--he who eats with me.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya seorang di antara kamu akan menyerahkan Aku, yaitu dia yang makan dengan Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They began to be sorrowful, and to ask him one by one,

block.text: Maka sedihlah hati mereka dan seorang demi seorang berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Surely not I?”

block.text: <<Bukan aku, ya Tuhan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Ia menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is one of the twelve, he who dips with me in the dish.

block.text: <<Orang itu ialah salah seorang dari kamu yang dua belas ini, dia yang mencelupkan roti ke dalam satu pinggan dengan Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man goes, even as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born.”

block.text: Anak Manusia memang akan pergi sesuai dengan yang ada tertulis tentang Dia, akan tetapi celakalah orang yang olehnya Anak Manusia itu diserahkan. Adalah lebih baik bagi orang itu sekiranya ia tidak dilahirkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had blessed, he broke it, and gave to them, and said,

block.text: Dan ketika Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya sedang makan, Yesus mengambil roti, mengucap berkat, memecah-mecahkannya lalu memberikannya kepada mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take and eat. This is my body.”

block.text: <<Ambillah, inilah tubuh-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave to them. They all drank of it.
He said to them,

block.text: Sesudah itu Ia mengambil cawan, mengucap syukur lalu memberikannya kepada mereka, dan mereka semuanya minum dari cawan itu.
Dan Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many.

block.text: <<Inilah darah-Ku, darah perjanjian, yang ditumpahkan bagi banyak orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, I will no more drink of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it anew in the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya Aku tidak akan minum lagi hasil pokok anggur sampai pada hari Aku meminumnya, yaitu yang baru, dalam Kerajaan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Sesudah mereka menyanyikan nyanyian pujian, pergilah mereka ke Bukit Zaitun.
Lalu Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’

block.text: <<Kamu semua akan tergoncang imanmu. Sebab ada tertulis: <Aku akan memukul gembala dan domba-domba itu akan tercerai-berai.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.”

block.text: Akan tetapi sesudah Aku bangkit, Aku akan mendahului kamu ke Galilea.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter said to him,

block.text: Kata Petrus kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Although all will be offended, yet I will not.”

block.text: <<Biarpun mereka semua tergoncang imannya, aku tidak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, that you today, even this night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya pada hari ini, malam ini juga, sebelum ayam berkokok dua kali, engkau telah menyangkal Aku tiga kali.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he spoke all the more,

block.text: Tetapi dengan lebih bersungguh-sungguh Petrus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I must die with you, I will not deny you.”

block.text: <<Sekalipun aku harus mati bersama-sama Engkau, aku takkan menyangkal Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all said the same thing.

block.text: Semua yang lainpun berkata demikian juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. He said to his disciples,

block.text: Lalu sampailah Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya ke suatu tempat yang bernama Getsemani. Kata Yesus kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sit here, while I pray.”

block.text: <<Duduklah di sini, sementara Aku berdoa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took with him Peter, James, and John, and began to be greatly troubled and distressed.
He said to them,

block.text: Dan Ia membawa Petrus, Yakobus dan Yohanes serta-Nya. Ia sangat takut dan gentar,
lalu kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here, and watch.”

block.text: <<Hati-Ku sangat sedih, seperti mau mati rasanya. Tinggallah di sini dan berjaga-jagalah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass away from him.
He said,

block.text: Ia maju sedikit, merebahkan diri ke tanah dan berdoa supaya, sekiranya mungkin, saat itu lalu dari pada-Nya.
Kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Abba, Father, all things are possible to you. Please remove this cup from me. However, not what I desire, but what you desire.”

block.text: <<Ya Abba, ya Bapa, tidak ada yang mustahil bagi-Mu, ambillah cawan ini dari pada-Ku, tetapi janganlah apa yang Aku kehendaki, melainkan apa yang Engkau kehendaki.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter,

block.text: Setelah itu Ia datang kembali, dan mendapati ketiganya sedang tidur. Dan Ia berkata kepada Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn’t you watch one hour?

block.text: <<Simon, sedang tidurkah engkau? Tidakkah engkau sanggup berjaga-jaga satu jam?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Watch and pray, that you may not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”

block.text: Berjaga-jagalah dan berdoalah, supaya kamu jangan jatuh ke dalam pencobaan; roh memang penurut, tetapi daging lemah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he went away, and prayed, saying the same words.

block.text: Lalu Ia pergi lagi dan mengucapkan doa yang itu juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he returned, and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy, and they didn’t know what to answer him.

block.text: Dan ketika Ia kembali pula, Ia mendapati mereka sedang tidur, sebab mata mereka sudah berat dan mereka tidak tahu jawab apa yang harus mereka berikan kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came the third time, and said to them,

block.text: Kemudian Ia kembali untuk ketiga kalinya dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sleep now and take your rest. It is enough. The hour has come. Behold, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

block.text: <<Tidurlah sekarang dan istirahatlah. Cukuplah. Saatnya sudah tiba, lihat, Anak Manusia diserahkan ke tangan orang-orang berdosa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Arise, let us be going. Behold, he who betrays me is at hand.”

block.text: Bangunlah, marilah kita pergi. Dia yang menyerahkan Aku sudah dekat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, came--and with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.

block.text: Waktu Yesus masih berbicara, muncullah Yudas, salah seorang dari kedua belas murid itu, dan bersama-sama dia serombongan orang yang membawa pedang dan pentung, disuruh oleh imam-imam kepala, ahli-ahli Taurat dan tua-tua.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he who betrayed him had given them a sign, saying,

block.text: Orang yang menyerahkan Dia telah memberitahukan tanda ini kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whomever I will kiss, that is him. Seize him, and lead him away safely.”

block.text: <<Orang yang akan kucium, itulah Dia, tangkaplah Dia dan bawalah Dia dengan selamat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come, immediately he came to him, and said,

block.text: Dan ketika ia sampai di situ ia segera maju mendapatkan Yesus dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi! Rabbi!”

block.text: <<Rabi,>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and kissed him.
They laid their hands on him, and seized him.

block.text: lalu mencium Dia.
Maka mereka memegang Yesus dan menangkap-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But a certain one of those who stood by drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, and
cut off his ear.
Jesus answered them,

block.text: Salah seorang dari mereka yang ada di situ menghunus pedangnya, lalu menetakkannya kepada hamba Imam Besar sehingga
putus telinganya.
Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to seize me?

block.text: <<Sangkamu Aku ini penyamun, maka kamu datang lengkap dengan pedang dan pentung untuk menangkap Aku?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you didn’t arrest me. But this is so that the Scriptures might be fulfilled.”

block.text: Padahal tiap-tiap hari Aku ada di tengah-tengah kamu mengajar di Bait Allah, dan kamu tidak menangkap Aku. Tetapi haruslah digenapi yang tertulis dalam Kitab Suci.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all left him, and fled.

block.text: Lalu semua murid itu meninggalkan Dia dan melarikan diri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain young man followed him, having a linen cloth thrown around himself, over his naked body. The young men grabbed him,

block.text: Ada seorang muda, yang pada waktu itu hanya memakai sehelai kain lenan untuk menutup badannya, mengikuti Dia. Mereka hendak menangkapnya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.

block.text: tetapi ia melepaskan kainnya dan lari dengan telanjang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They led Jesus away to the high priest. All the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes came together with him.

block.text: Kemudian Yesus dibawa menghadap Imam Besar. Lalu semua imam kepala, tua-tua dan ahli Taurat berkumpul di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter had followed him from a distance, until he came into the court of the high priest. He was sitting with the officers, and warming himself in the light of the fire.

block.text: Dan Petrus mengikuti Dia dari jauh, sampai ke dalam halaman Imam Besar, dan di sana ia duduk di antara pengawal-pengawal sambil berdiang dekat api.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the chief priests and the whole council sought witnesses against Jesus to put him to death, and found none.

block.text: Imam-imam kepala, malah seluruh Mahkamah Agama mencari kesaksian terhadap Yesus supaya Ia dapat dihukum mati, tetapi mereka tidak memperolehnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For many gave false testimony against him, and their testimony didn’t agree with each other.

block.text: Banyak juga orang yang mengucapkan kesaksian palsu terhadap Dia, tetapi kesaksian-kesaksian itu tidak sesuai yang satu dengan yang lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some stood up, and gave false testimony against him, saying,

block.text: Lalu beberapa orang naik saksi melawan Dia dengan tuduhan palsu ini:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.’”

block.text: <<Kami sudah mendengar orang ini berkata: <Aku akan merubuhkan Bait Suci buatan tangan manusia ini dan dalam tiga hari akan Kudirikan yang lain, yang bukan buatan tangan manusia.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so, their testimony did not agree.

block.text: Dalam hal inipun kesaksian mereka tidak sesuai yang satu dengan yang lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest stood up in the midst, and asked Jesus,

block.text: Maka Imam Besar bangkit berdiri di tengah-tengah sidang dan bertanya kepada Yesus, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have you no answer? What is it which these testify against you?”

block.text: <<Tidakkah Engkau memberi jawab atas tuduhan-tuduhan saksi-saksi ini terhadap Engkau?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he stayed quiet, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him,

block.text: Tetapi Ia tetap diam dan tidak menjawab apa-apa. Imam Besar itu bertanya kepada-Nya sekali lagi, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?”

block.text: <<Apakah Engkau Mesias, Anak dari Yang Terpuji?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am. You will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of the sky.”

block.text: <<Akulah Dia, dan kamu akan melihat Anak Manusia duduk di sebelah kanan Yang Mahakuasa dan datang di tengah-tengah awan-awan di langit.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest tore his clothes, and said,

block.text: Maka Imam Besar itu mengoyakkan pakaiannya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What further need have we of witnesses?
You have heard the blasphemy! What do you think?”

block.text: <<Untuk apa kita perlu saksi lagi?
Kamu sudah mendengar hujat-Nya terhadap Allah. Bagaimana pendapat kamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all condemned him saying:

block.text: Lalu dengan suara bulat mereka memutuskan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He deserves to die!”

block.text: bahwa Dia harus dihukum mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to beat him with fists, and to tell him,

block.text: Lalu mulailah beberapa orang meludahi Dia dan menutupi muka-Nya dan meninju-Nya sambil berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Prophesy!”

block.text: <<Hai nabi, cobalah terka!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The officers struck him with the palms of their hands.

block.text: Malah para pengawalpun memukul Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Peter was in the courtyard below, one of the servants of the high priest came.

block.text: Pada waktu itu Petrus masih ada di bawah, di halaman. Lalu datanglah seorang hamba perempuan Imam Besar,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing Peter warming himself, she looked at him, and said,

block.text: dan ketika perempuan itu melihat Petrus sedang berdiang, ia menatap mukanya dan berkata:

block.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard
ReferenceBlocks.text: “You were also with the Nazarene, Jesus!”

block.text: <<Engkau juga selalu bersama-sama dengan Yesus, orang Nazaret itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he denied it, saying,

block.text: Tetapi ia menyangkalnya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I neither know, nor understand what you are saying.”

block.text: <<Aku tidak tahu dan tidak mengerti apa yang engkau maksud.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went out on the porch, and the rooster crowed.

block.text: Lalu ia pergi ke serambi muka (dan berkokoklah ayam).

ReferenceBlocks.text: The servant girl saw him, and began again to tell those who stood by,

block.text: Ketika hamba perempuan itu melihat Petrus lagi, berkatalah ia pula kepada orang-orang yang ada di situ:

block.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard
ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is one of them.”

block.text: <<Orang ini adalah salah seorang dari mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But again Peter denied it, saying:

block.text: Tetapi Petrus

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I don’t know him!”

block.text: menyangkalnya pula.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, after a little while, those who stood by said to Peter:

block.text: Tidak lama kemudian orang-orang yang ada di situ berkata juga kepada Petrus:

block.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)/those standing near

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)/those standing near
ReferenceBlocks.characterIdOverrideForScript: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “You truly are one of them, for you are a Galilean, and your speech shows it.”

block.text: <<Engkau ini pasti salah seorang dari mereka, apalagi engkau seorang Galilea!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he began to curse, and to swear,

block.text: Maka mulailah Petrus mengutuk dan bersumpah:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I don’t know this man of whom you speak!”

block.text: <<Aku tidak kenal orang yang kamu sebut-sebut ini!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The rooster crowed the second time. Peter remembered the word, how that Jesus said to him,

block.text: Dan pada saat itu berkokoklah ayam untuk kedua kalinya. Maka teringatlah Petrus, bahwa Yesus telah berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”

block.text: <<Sebelum ayam berkokok dua kali, engkau telah menyangkal Aku tiga kali.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he thought about that, he wept.

block.text: Lalu menangislah ia tersedu-sedu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 15
Immediately in the morning the chief priests, with the elders and scribes, and the whole council, held a consultation, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him up to Pilate.
Pilate asked him,

block.text: Pagi-pagi benar imam-imam kepala bersama tua-tua dan ahli-ahli Taurat dan seluruh Mahkamah Agama sudah bulat mupakatnya. Mereka membelenggu Yesus lalu membawa-Nya dan menyerahkan-Nya kepada Pilatus.
Pilatus bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the King of the Jews?”

block.text: <<Engkaukah raja orang Yahudi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes… It is as you say.”

block.text: <<Engkau sendiri mengatakannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests accused him of many things.
Pilate again asked him,

block.text: Lalu imam-imam kepala mengajukan banyak tuduhan terhadap Dia.
Pilatus bertanya pula kepada-Nya, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have you no answer? See how many things they testify against you!”

block.text: <<Tidakkah Engkau memberi jawab? Lihatlah betapa banyaknya tuduhan mereka terhadap Engkau!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus made no further answer, so that Pilate marveled.

block.text: Tetapi Yesus sama sekali tidak menjawab lagi, sehingga Pilatus merasa heran.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now at the feast he used to release to them one prisoner, whom they asked of him.

block.text: Telah menjadi kebiasaan untuk membebaskan satu orang hukuman pada tiap-tiap hari raya itu menurut permintaan orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There was one called Barabbas, bound with those who had made insurrection, men who in the insurrection had committed murder.

block.text: Dan pada waktu itu adalah seorang yang bernama Barabas sedang dipenjarakan bersama beberapa orang pemberontak lainnya. Mereka telah melakukan pembunuhan dalam pemberontakan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude, crying aloud, said to Pilate:

block.text: Maka datanglah orang banyak dan meminta supaya

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do for us what you have always done for us in the past!”

block.text: sekarang kebiasaan itu diikuti juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate answered them, saying,

block.text: Pilatus menjawab mereka dan bertanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”

block.text: <<Apakah kamu menghendaki supaya kubebaskan raja orang Yahudi ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he perceived that for envy the chief priests had delivered him up.

block.text: Ia memang mengetahui, bahwa imam-imam kepala telah menyerahkan Yesus karena dengki.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the chief priests stirred up the people to yell:

block.text: Tetapi imam-imam kepala menghasut orang banyak untuk meminta

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give us Barrabus!”

block.text: supaya Barabaslah yang dibebaskannya bagi mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate again asked them,

block.text: Pilatus sekali lagi menjawab dan bertanya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What then should I do to him whom you call the King of the Jews?”

block.text: <<Jika begitu, apakah yang harus kuperbuat dengan orang yang kamu sebut raja orang Yahudi ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They cried out again,

block.text: Maka mereka berteriak lagi, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Crucify him!”

block.text: <<Salibkanlah Dia!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate said to them,

block.text: Lalu Pilatus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why, what evil has he done?”

block.text: <<Tetapi kejahatan apakah yang telah dilakukan-Nya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they cried out exceedingly,

block.text: Namun mereka makin keras berteriak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Crucify him!”

block.text: <<Salibkanlah Dia!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate, wishing to please the multitude, released Barabbas to them, and handed over Jesus, when he had flogged him, to be crucified.

block.text: Dan oleh karena Pilatus ingin memuaskan hati orang banyak itu, ia membebaskan Barabas bagi mereka. Tetapi Yesus disesahnya lalu diserahkannya untuk disalibkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Praetorium; and they called together the whole cohort.

block.text: Kemudian serdadu-serdadu membawa Yesus ke dalam istana, yaitu gedung pengadilan, dan memanggil seluruh pasukan berkumpul.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They clothed him with purple, and weaving a crown of thorns, they put it on him.

block.text: Mereka mengenakan jubah ungu kepada-Nya, menganyam sebuah mahkota duri dan menaruhnya di atas kepala-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They began to salute him,

block.text: Kemudian mereka mulai memberi hormat kepada-Nya, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hail, King of the Jews!”

block.text: <<Salam, hai raja orang Yahudi!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They struck his head with a reed, and spat on him, and bowing their knees, did homage to him.

block.text: Mereka memukul kepala-Nya dengan buluh, dan meludahi-Nya dan berlutut menyembah-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had mocked him, they took the purple off of him, and put his own garments on him. They led him out to crucify him.

block.text: Sesudah mengolok-olokkan Dia mereka menanggalkan jubah ungu itu dari pada-Nya dan mengenakan pula pakaian-Nya kepada-Nya. Kemudian Yesus dibawa ke luar untuk disalibkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They compelled one passing by, coming from the country, Simon of Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to go with them, that he might bear his cross.

block.text: Pada waktu itu lewat seorang yang bernama Simon, orang Kirene, ayah Aleksander dan Rufus, yang baru datang dari luar kota, dan orang itu mereka paksa untuk memikul salib Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought him to the place called Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, “The place of a skull.”

block.text: Mereka membawa Yesus ke tempat yang bernama Golgota, yang berarti: Tempat Tengkorak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he didn’t take it.

block.text: Lalu mereka memberi anggur bercampur mur kepada-Nya, tetapi Ia menolaknya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Crucifying him, they parted his garments among them, casting lots on them, what each should take.

block.text: Kemudian mereka menyalibkan Dia, lalu mereka membagi pakaian-Nya dengan membuang undi atasnya untuk menentukan bagian masing-masing.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was the third hour, and they crucified him.

block.text: Hari jam sembilan ketika Ia disalibkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The superscription of his accusation was written over him, “THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

block.text: Dan alasan mengapa Ia dihukum disebut pada tulisan yang terpasang di situ: Raja orang Yahudi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: With him they crucified two robbers; one on his right hand, and one on his left.

block.text: Bersama dengan Dia disalibkan dua orang penyamun, seorang di sebelah kanan-Nya dan seorang di sebelah kiri-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Scripture was fulfilled, which says,

block.text: (Demikian genaplah nas Alkitab yang berbunyi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He was numbered with transgressors.”

block.text: <<Ia akan terhitung di antara orang-orang durhaka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads, and saying,

block.text: Orang-orang yang lewat di sana menghujat Dia, dan sambil menggelengkan kepala mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ha! You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days,
save yourself, and come down from the cross!”

block.text: <<Hai Engkau yang mau merubuhkan Bait Suci dan mau membangunnya kembali dalam tiga hari,
turunlah dari salib itu dan selamatkan diri-Mu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Likewise, also the chief priests mocking among themselves with the scribes said,

block.text: Demikian juga imam-imam kepala bersama-sama ahli Taurat mengolok-olokkan Dia di antara mereka sendiri dan mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He saved others. He can’t save himself.

block.text: <<Orang lain Ia selamatkan, tetapi diri-Nya sendiri tidak dapat Ia selamatkan!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe him.”

block.text: Baiklah Mesias, Raja Israel itu, turun dari salib itu, supaya kita lihat dan percaya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were crucified with him insulted him.

block.text: Bahkan kedua orang yang disalibkan bersama-sama dengan Dia mencela Dia juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

block.text: Pada jam dua belas, kegelapan meliputi seluruh daerah itu dan berlangsung sampai jam tiga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying,

block.text: Dan pada jam tiga berserulah Yesus dengan suara nyaring:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?”

block.text: <<Eloi, Eloi, lama sabakhtani?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: which is, being interpreted,

block.text: yang berarti:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”

block.text: <<Allahku, Allahku, mengapa Engkau meninggalkan Aku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said,

block.text: Mendengar itu, beberapa orang yang berdiri di situ berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, he is calling Elijah.”

block.text: <<Lihat, Ia memanggil Elia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: One ran, and filling a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave it to him to drink, saying,

block.text: Maka datanglah seorang dengan bunga karang, mencelupkannya ke dalam anggur asam lalu mencucukkannya pada sebatang buluh dan memberi Yesus minum serta berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let him be. Let’s see whether Elijah comes to take him down.”

block.text: <<Baiklah kita tunggu dan melihat apakah Elia datang untuk menurunkan Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus cried out with a loud voice, and gave up the spirit.

block.text: Lalu berserulah Yesus dengan suara nyaring dan menyerahkan nyawa-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom.

block.text: Ketika itu tabir Bait Suci terbelah dua dari atas sampai ke bawah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the centurion, who stood by opposite him, saw that he cried out like this and breathed his last, he said,

block.text: Waktu kepala pasukan yang berdiri berhadapan dengan Dia melihat mati-Nya demikian, berkatalah ia:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly this man was the Son of God!”

block.text: <<Sungguh, orang ini adalah Anak Allah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were also women watching from afar, among whom were both Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome.

block.text: Ada juga beberapa perempuan yang melihat dari jauh, di antaranya Maria Magdalena, Maria ibu Yakobus Muda dan Yoses, serta Salome.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In Galilee, these women had followed him and served him. Many other women who came up with him to Jerusalem where there also.

block.text: Mereka semuanya telah mengikut Yesus dan melayani-Nya waktu Ia di Galilea. Dan ada juga di situ banyak perempuan lain yang telah datang ke Yerusalem bersama-sama dengan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening had now come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,
Joseph of Arimathaea, a prominent council member who also himself was looking for the Kingdom of God, came. He boldly went in to Pilate, and said:

block.text: Sementara itu hari mulai malam, dan hari itu adalah hari persiapan, yaitu hari menjelang Sabat.
Karena itu Yusuf, orang Arimatea, seorang anggota Majelis Besar yang terkemuka, yang juga menanti-nantikan Kerajaan Allah, memberanikan diri menghadap Pilatus dan

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give me the body of Jesus.”

block.text: meminta mayat Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate was surprised to hear that Jesus might already be dead, so he summoned the centurion he asked him:

block.text: Pilatus heran bahwa Yesus telah mati. Dia memanggil komandan dan bertanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is he already dead?”

block.text: "Apakah dia sudah mati?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: The centurion said:

block.text: Perwira itu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, he is dead.”

block.text: "Ya, dia sudah mati."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Pilate said to Joseph:

block.text: Lalu Pilatus berkata kepada Yusuf:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You may take his body.”

block.text: "Anda dapat mengambil tubuhnya."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been cut out of a rock. He rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.

block.text: Yusufpun membeli kain lenan, kemudian ia menurunkan mayat Yesus dari salib dan mengapaninya dengan kain lenan itu. Lalu ia membaringkan Dia di dalam kubur yang digali di dalam bukit batu. Kemudian digulingkannya sebuah batu ke pintu kubur itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Mary Magdalene and Mary, the mother of Joses, saw where he was laid.

block.text: Maria Magdalena dan Maria ibu Yoses melihat di mana Yesus dibaringkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK 16
When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, bought spices, that they might come and anoint him.

block.text: Setelah lewat hari Sabat, Maria Magdalena dan Maria ibu Yakobus, serta Salome membeli rempah-rempah untuk pergi ke kubur dan meminyaki Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Very early on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb when the sun had risen.

block.text: Dan pagi-pagi benar pada hari pertama minggu itu, setelah matahari terbit, pergilah mereka ke kubur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were saying among themselves,

block.text: Mereka berkata seorang kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who will roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us?”

block.text: <<Siapa yang akan menggulingkan batu itu bagi kita dari pintu kubur?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: for it was very big. Looking up, they saw that the stone was rolled back.

block.text: Tetapi ketika mereka melihat dari dekat, tampaklah, batu yang memang sangat besar itu sudah terguling.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Entering into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, dressed in a white robe, and they were amazed.
He said to them,

block.text: Lalu mereka masuk ke dalam kubur dan mereka melihat seorang muda yang memakai jubah putih duduk di sebelah kanan. Merekapun sangat terkejut,
tetapi orang muda itu berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t be alarmed. You seek Jesus, the Nazarene, who has been crucified. He has risen. He is not here. Behold, the place where they laid him!

block.text: <<Jangan takut! Kamu mencari Yesus orang Nazaret, yang disalibkan itu. Ia telah bangkit. Ia tidak ada di sini. Lihat! Inilah tempat mereka membaringkan Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He goes before you into Galilee. There you will see him, as he said to you.’”

block.text: Tetapi sekarang pergilah, katakanlah kepada murid-murid-Nya dan kepada Petrus: <Ia mendahului kamu ke Galilea; di sana kamu akan melihat Dia, seperti yang sudah dikatakan-Nya kepada kamu.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went out, and fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had come on them. They said nothing to anyone; for they were afraid.

block.text: Lalu mereka keluar dan lari meninggalkan kubur itu, sebab gentar dan dahsyat menimpa mereka. Mereka tidak mengatakan apa-apa kepada siapapun juga karena takut. Dengan singkat mereka sampaikan semua pesan itu kepada Petrus dan teman-temannya. Sesudah itu Yesus sendiri dengan perantaraan murid-murid-Nya memberitakan dari Timur ke Barat berita yang kudus dan tak terbinasakan tentang keselamatan yang kekal itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when he had risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.

block.text: Setelah Yesus bangkit pagi-pagi pada hari pertama minggu itu, Ia mula-mula menampakkan diri-Nya kepada Maria Magdalena. Dari padanya Yesus pernah mengusir tujuh setan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She went and told those who had been with him, as they mourned and wept.

block.text: Lalu perempuan itu pergi memberitahukannya kepada mereka yang selalu mengiringi Yesus, dan yang pada waktu itu sedang berkabung dan menangis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard that he was alive, and had been seen by her, they disbelieved.

block.text: Tetapi ketika mereka mendengar, bahwa Yesus hidup dan telah dilihat olehnya, mereka tidak percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these things he was revealed in another form to two of them, as they walked, on their way into the country.

block.text: Sesudah itu Ia menampakkan diri dalam rupa yang lain kepada dua orang dari mereka, ketika keduanya dalam perjalanan ke luar kota.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went away and told it to the rest. They didn’t believe them, either.

block.text: Lalu kembalilah mereka dan memberitahukannya kepada teman-teman yang lain, tetapi kepada merekapun teman-teman itu tidak percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Afterward he appeared to the eleven as they sat at the table, and he rebuked them saying:

block.text: Akhirnya Ia menampakkan diri kepada kesebelas orang itu ketika mereka sedang makan, dan Ia mencela ketidakpercayaan dan kedegilan hati mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your hearts are hard! Why did you not believe the others who had seen me?”

block.text: oleh karena mereka tidak percaya kepada orang-orang yang telah melihat Dia sesudah kebangkitan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Lalu Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go into all the world, and preach the Good News to the whole creation.

block.text: <<Pergilah ke seluruh dunia, beritakanlah Injil kepada segala makhluk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who disbelieves will be condemned.

block.text: Siapa yang percaya dan dibaptis akan diselamatkan, tetapi siapa yang tidak percaya akan dihukum.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These signs will accompany those who believe: in my name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new languages;

block.text: Tanda-tanda ini akan menyertai orang-orang yang percaya: mereka akan mengusir setan-setan demi nama-Ku, mereka akan berbicara dalam bahasa-bahasa yang baru bagi mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: they will take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it will in no way hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.”

block.text: mereka akan memegang ular, dan sekalipun mereka minum racun maut, mereka tidak akan mendapat celaka; mereka akan meletakkan tangannya atas orang sakit, dan orang itu akan sembuh.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then the Lord, after he had spoken to them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.

block.text: Sesudah Tuhan Yesus berbicara demikian kepada mereka, terangkatlah Ia ke sorga, lalu duduk di sebelah kanan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went out, and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them, and confirming the word by the signs that followed. Amen.

block.text: Merekapun pergilah memberitakan Injil ke segala penjuru, dan Tuhan turut bekerja dan meneguhkan firman itu dengan tanda-tanda yang menyertainya.
